RDFS
The Rice Comp413 2017 class' continuation on the work of the 2016 RDFS.

easylogging++.h
1 //
2 // Bismillah ar-Rahmaan ar-Raheem
3 //
4 // Easylogging++ v9.83
5 // Single-header only, cross-platform logging library for C++ applications
6 //
7 // Copyright (c) 2016 muflihun.com
8 //
9 // This library is released under the MIT Licence.
10 // http://easylogging.muflihun.com/licence.php
11 //
12 // easylogging@muflihun.com
13 //
14 // https://github.com/easylogging/easyloggingpp
15 // http://easylogging.muflihun.com
16 // http://muflihun.com
17 //
18 #ifndef EASYLOGGINGPP_H
19 #define EASYLOGGINGPP_H
20 // Compilers and C++0x/C++11 Evaluation
21 #if (defined(__GNUC__))
22 # define ELPP_COMPILER_GCC 1
23 #else
24 # define ELPP_COMPILER_GCC 0
25 #endif
26 #if ELPP_COMPILER_GCC
27 # define ELPP_GCC_VERSION (__GNUC__ * 10000 \
28 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 \
29 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)
30 # if defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__)
31 # define ELPP_CXX0X 1
32 # elif(ELPP_GCC_VERSION >= 40801)
33 # define ELPP_CXX11 1
34 # endif
35 #endif
36 // Visual C++
37 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
38 # define ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC 1
39 #else
40 # define ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC 0
41 #endif
42 #define ELPP_CRT_DBG_WARNINGS ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
43 #if ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
44 # if (_MSC_VER == 1600)
45 # define ELPP_CXX0X 1
46 # elif(_MSC_VER >= 1700)
47 # define ELPP_CXX11 1
48 # endif
49 #endif
50 // Clang++
51 #if (defined(__clang__) && (__clang__ == 1))
52 # define ELPP_COMPILER_CLANG 1
53 #else
54 # define ELPP_COMPILER_CLANG 0
55 #endif
56 #if ELPP_COMPILER_CLANG
57 # define ELPP_CLANG_VERSION (__clang_major__ * 10000 \
58 + __clang_minor__ * 100 \
59 + __clang_patchlevel__)
60 # if (ELPP_CLANG_VERSION >= 30300)
61 # define ELPP_CXX11 1
62 # endif // (ELPP_CLANG_VERSION >= 30300)
63 #endif
64 #if (defined(__MINGW32__) || defined(__MINGW64__))
65 # define ELPP_MINGW 1
66 #else
67 # define ELPP_MINGW 0
68 #endif
69 #if (defined(__CYGWIN__) && (__CYGWIN__ == 1))
70 # define ELPP_CYGWIN 1
71 #else
72 # define ELPP_CYGWIN 0
73 #endif
74 #if (defined(__INTEL_COMPILER))
75 # define ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL 1
76 #else
77 # define ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL 0
78 #endif
79 // Operating System Evaluation
80 // Windows
81 #if (defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64))
82 # define ELPP_OS_WINDOWS 1
83 #else
84 # define ELPP_OS_WINDOWS 0
85 #endif
86 // Linux
87 #if (defined(__linux) || defined(__linux__))
88 # define ELPP_OS_LINUX 1
89 #else
90 # define ELPP_OS_LINUX 0
91 #endif
92 #if (defined(__APPLE__))
93 # define ELPP_OS_MAC 1
94 #else
95 # define ELPP_OS_MAC 0
96 #endif
97 #if (defined(__FreeBSD__))
98 # define ELPP_OS_FREEBSD 1
99 #else
100 # define ELPP_OS_FREEBSD 0
101 #endif
102 #if (defined(__sun))
103 # define ELPP_OS_SOLARIS 1
104 #else
105 # define ELPP_OS_SOLARIS 0
106 #endif
107 // Unix
108 #if ((ELPP_OS_LINUX || ELPP_OS_MAC || ELPP_OS_FREEBSD || ELPP_OS_SOLARIS) && (!ELPP_OS_WINDOWS))
109 # define ELPP_OS_UNIX 1
110 #else
111 # define ELPP_OS_UNIX 0
112 #endif
113 #if (defined(__ANDROID__))
114 # define ELPP_OS_ANDROID 1
115 #else
116 # define ELPP_OS_ANDROID 0
117 #endif
118 // Evaluating Cygwin as *nix OS
119 #if !ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_WINDOWS && ELPP_CYGWIN
120 # undef ELPP_OS_UNIX
121 # undef ELPP_OS_LINUX
122 # define ELPP_OS_UNIX 1
123 # define ELPP_OS_LINUX 1
124 #endif // !ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_WINDOWS && ELPP_CYGWIN
125 #if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_INFO)
126 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_INFO std::cout
127 #endif // !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT)
128 #if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR)
129 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR std::cerr
130 #endif // !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT)
131 #if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL)
132 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL std::endl
133 #endif // !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT)
134 #if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG)
135 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(msg) msg
136 #endif // !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT)
137 // Internal Assertions and errors
138 #if !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_ASSERT)
139 # if (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ASSERT_FAILURE))
140 # define ELPP_ASSERT(expr, msg) if (!(expr)) { \
141 std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << msg; \
142 ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR \
143 << "EASYLOGGING++ ASSERTION FAILED (LINE: " << __LINE__ << ") [" #expr << "] WITH MESSAGE \"" \
144 << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) << "\"" << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; base::utils::abort(1, \
145 "ELPP Assertion failure, please define ELPP_DEBUG_ASSERT_FAILURE"); }
146 # else
147 # define ELPP_ASSERT(expr, msg) if (!(expr)) { \
148 std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << msg; \
149 ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR\
150 << "ASSERTION FAILURE FROM EASYLOGGING++ (LINE: " \
151 << __LINE__ << ") [" #expr << "] WITH MESSAGE \"" << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) << "\"" \
152 << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; }
153 # endif // (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ASSERT_FAILURE))
154 #else
155 # define ELPP_ASSERT(x, y)
156 #endif //(!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_ASSERT)
157 #if ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
158 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_WRITE_PERROR \
159 { char buff[256]; strerror_s(buff, 256, errno); \
160 ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR << ": " << buff << " [" << errno << "]";} (void)0
161 #else
162 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_WRITE_PERROR \
163 ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR << ": " << strerror(errno) << " [" << errno << "]"; (void)0
164 #endif // ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
165 #if defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ERRORS)
166 # if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR)
167 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR(msg, pe) { \
168 std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << "<ERROR> " << msg; \
169 ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR \
170 << "ERROR FROM EASYLOGGING++ (LINE: " << __LINE__ << ") " \
171 << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; \
172 if (pe) { ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR << " "; ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_WRITE_PERROR; }} (void)0
173 # endif
174 #else
175 # undef ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO
176 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR(msg, pe)
177 #endif // defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ERRORS)
178 #if (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_INFO))
179 # if !(defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL))
180 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL 9
181 # endif // !(defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL))
182 # if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO)
183 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(lvl, msg) { if (lvl <= ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL) { \
184 std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << "<INFO> " << msg; \
185 ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_INFO << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) \
186 << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; }}
187 # endif
188 #else
189 # undef ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO
190 # define ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(lvl, msg)
191 #endif // (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_INFO))
192 #if defined(ELPP_STACKTRACE_ON_CRASH)
193 # if (ELPP_COMPILER_GCC && !ELPP_MINGW)
194 # define ELPP_STACKTRACE 1
195 # else
196 # if ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
197 # pragma message("Stack trace not available for this compiler")
198 # else
199 # warning "Stack trace not available for this compiler";
200 # endif // ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
201 # endif // ELPP_COMPILER_GCC
202 #endif // (defined(ELPP_STACKTRACE_ON_CRASH))
203 // Miscellaneous macros
204 #define ELPP_UNUSED(x) (void)x
205 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX
206 // Log file permissions for unix-based systems
207 # define ELPP_LOG_PERMS S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IXUSR | S_IWGRP | S_IRGRP | S_IXGRP | S_IWOTH | S_IXOTH
208 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
209 #if defined(ELPP_AS_DLL) && ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
210 # if defined(ELPP_EXPORT_SYMBOLS)
211 # define ELPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
212 # else
213 # define ELPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllimport)
214 # endif // defined(ELPP_EXPORT_SYMBOLS)
215 #else
216 # define ELPP_EXPORT
217 #endif // defined(ELPP_AS_DLL) && ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
218 // Some special functions that are VC++ specific
219 #undef STRTOK
220 #undef STRERROR
221 #undef STRCAT
222 #undef STRCPY
223 #if ELPP_CRT_DBG_WARNINGS
224 # define STRTOK(a, b, c) strtok_s(a, b, c)
225 # define STRERROR(a, b, c) strerror_s(a, b, c)
226 # define STRCAT(a, b, len) strcat_s(a, len, b)
227 # define STRCPY(a, b, len) strcpy_s(a, len, b)
228 #else
229 # define STRTOK(a, b, c) strtok(a, b)
230 # define STRERROR(a, b, c) strerror(c)
231 # define STRCAT(a, b, len) strcat(a, b)
232 # define STRCPY(a, b, len) strcpy(a, b)
233 #endif
234 // Compiler specific support evaluations
235 #if ((!ELPP_MINGW && !ELPP_COMPILER_CLANG) || defined(ELPP_FORCE_USE_STD_THREAD))
236 # define ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING 1
237 #else
238 # define ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING 0
239 #endif
240 #undef ELPP_FINAL
241 #if ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL || (ELPP_GCC_VERSION < 40702)
242 # define ELPP_FINAL
243 #else
244 # define ELPP_FINAL final
245 #endif // ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL || (ELPP_GCC_VERSION < 40702)
246 #if defined(ELPP_EXPERIMENTAL_ASYNC)
247 # define ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING 1
248 #else
249 # define ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING 0
250 #endif // defined(ELPP_EXPERIMENTAL_ASYNC)
251 #if defined(ELPP_THREAD_SAFE) || ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
252 # define ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED 1
253 #else
254 # define ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED 0
255 #endif // defined(ELPP_THREAD_SAFE) || ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
256 // Function macro ELPP_FUNC
257 #undef ELPP_FUNC
258 #if ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC // Visual C++
259 # define ELPP_FUNC __FUNCSIG__
260 #elif ELPP_COMPILER_GCC // GCC
261 # define ELPP_FUNC __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
262 #elif ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL // Intel C++
263 # define ELPP_FUNC __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
264 #elif ELPP_COMPILER_CLANG // Clang++
265 # define ELPP_FUNC __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
266 #else
267 # if defined(__func__)
268 # define ELPP_FUNC __func__
269 # else
270 # define ELPP_FUNC ""
271 # endif // defined(__func__)
272 #endif // defined(_MSC_VER)
273 #undef ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
274 // Keep following line commented until features are fixed
275 #define ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED \
276 (ELPP_COMPILER_GCC || ELPP_COMPILER_CLANG || ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL || (ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC && _MSC_VER >= 1800))
277 // Logging Enable/Disable macros
278 #define ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_LOGS))
279 #if (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_DEBUG_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED) && ((defined(_DEBUG)) || (!defined(NDEBUG))))
280 # define ELPP_DEBUG_LOG 1
281 #else
282 # define ELPP_DEBUG_LOG 0
283 #endif // (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_DEBUG_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED) && ((defined(_DEBUG)) || (!defined(NDEBUG))))
284 #if (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_INFO_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
285 # define ELPP_INFO_LOG 1
286 #else
287 # define ELPP_INFO_LOG 0
288 #endif // (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_INFO_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
289 #if (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_WARNING_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
290 # define ELPP_WARNING_LOG 1
291 #else
292 # define ELPP_WARNING_LOG 0
293 #endif // (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_WARNING_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
294 #if (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_ERROR_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
295 # define ELPP_ERROR_LOG 1
296 #else
297 # define ELPP_ERROR_LOG 0
298 #endif // (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_ERROR_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
299 #if (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_FATAL_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
300 # define ELPP_FATAL_LOG 1
301 #else
302 # define ELPP_FATAL_LOG 0
303 #endif // (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_FATAL_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
304 #if (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_TRACE_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
305 # define ELPP_TRACE_LOG 1
306 #else
307 # define ELPP_TRACE_LOG 0
308 #endif // (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_TRACE_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
309 #if (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_VERBOSE_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
310 # define ELPP_VERBOSE_LOG 1
311 #else
312 # define ELPP_VERBOSE_LOG 0
313 #endif // (!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_VERBOSE_LOGS) && (ELPP_LOGGING_ENABLED))
314 #if (!(ELPP_CXX0X || ELPP_CXX11))
315 # error "Easylogging++ 9.0+ is only compatible with C++0x (or higher) compliant compiler"
316 #endif // (!(ELPP_CXX0X || ELPP_CXX11))
317 // Headers
318 #if defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
319 # include <syslog.h>
320 #endif // defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
321 #include <ctime>
322 #include <cstring>
323 #include <cstdlib>
324 #include <cctype>
325 #include <cwchar>
326 #include <csignal>
327 #include <cerrno>
328 #include <cstdarg>
329 #if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
330 # include <locale>
331 # if ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
332 # include <codecvt>
333 # endif // ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
334 #endif // defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
335 #if ELPP_STACKTRACE
336 # include <cxxabi.h>
337 # include <execinfo.h>
338 #endif // ELPP_STACKTRACE
339 #if ELPP_OS_ANDROID
340 # include <sys/system_properties.h>
341 #endif // ELPP_OS_ANDROID
342 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX
343 # include <sys/stat.h>
344 # include <sys/time.h>
345 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
346 # include <direct.h>
347 # include <windows.h>
348 # if defined(WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN)
349 # if defined(ELPP_WINSOCK2)
350 # include <winsock2.h>
351 # else
352 # include <winsock.h>
353 # endif // defined(ELPP_WINSOCK2)
354 # endif // defined(WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN)
355 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
356 #include <string>
357 #include <vector>
358 #include <map>
359 #include <utility>
360 #include <functional>
361 #include <algorithm>
362 #include <fstream>
363 #include <iostream>
364 #include <sstream>
365 #include <memory>
366 #include <type_traits>
367 #if ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED
368 # if ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING
369 # include <mutex>
370 # include <thread>
371 # else
372 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX
373 # include <pthread.h>
374 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
375 # endif // ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING
376 #endif // ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED
377 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
378 # if defined(ELPP_NO_SLEEP_FOR)
379 # include <unistd.h>
380 # endif // defined(ELPP_NO_SLEEP_FOR)
381 # include <thread>
382 # include <queue>
383 # include <condition_variable>
384 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
385 #if defined(ELPP_STL_LOGGING)
386 // For logging STL based templates
387 # include <list>
388 # include <queue>
389 # include <deque>
390 # include <set>
391 # include <bitset>
392 # include <stack>
393 # if defined(ELPP_LOG_STD_ARRAY)
394 # include <array>
395 # endif // defined(ELPP_LOG_STD_ARRAY)
396 # if defined(ELPP_LOG_UNORDERED_MAP)
397 # include <unordered_map>
398 # endif // defined(ELPP_LOG_UNORDERED_MAP)
399 # if defined(ELPP_LOG_UNORDERED_SET)
400 # include <unordered_set>
401 # endif // defined(ELPP_UNORDERED_SET)
402 #endif // defined(ELPP_STL_LOGGING)
403 #if defined(ELPP_QT_LOGGING)
404 // For logging Qt based classes & templates
405 # include <QString>
406 # include <QByteArray>
407 # include <QVector>
408 # include <QList>
409 # include <QPair>
410 # include <QMap>
411 # include <QQueue>
412 # include <QSet>
413 # include <QLinkedList>
414 # include <QHash>
415 # include <QMultiHash>
416 # include <QStack>
417 #endif // defined(ELPP_QT_LOGGING)
418 #if defined(ELPP_BOOST_LOGGING)
419 // For logging boost based classes & templates
420 # include <boost/container/vector.hpp>
421 # include <boost/container/stable_vector.hpp>
422 # include <boost/container/list.hpp>
423 # include <boost/container/deque.hpp>
424 # include <boost/container/map.hpp>
425 # include <boost/container/flat_map.hpp>
426 # include <boost/container/set.hpp>
427 # include <boost/container/flat_set.hpp>
428 #endif // defined(ELPP_BOOST_LOGGING)
429 #if defined(ELPP_WXWIDGETS_LOGGING)
430 // For logging wxWidgets based classes & templates
431 # include <wx/vector.h>
432 #endif // defined(ELPP_WXWIDGETS_LOGGING)
433 // Forward declarations
434 namespace el {
435  class Logger;
436  class LogMessage;
437  class PerformanceTrackingData;
438  class Loggers;
439  class Helpers;
440  template <typename T> class Callback;
441  class LogDispatchCallback;
442  class PerformanceTrackingCallback;
443  class LogDispatchData;
444  namespace base {
445  class Storage;
446  class RegisteredLoggers;
447  class PerformanceTracker;
448  class MessageBuilder;
449  class Writer;
450  class PErrorWriter;
451  class LogDispatcher;
452  class DefaultLogBuilder;
453  class DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
454 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
455  class AsyncLogDispatchCallback;
456  class AsyncDispatchWorker;
457 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
458  class DefaultPerformanceTrackingCallback;
459  } // namespace base
460 } // namespace el
462 namespace el {
464  namespace base {
466  namespace type {
467 #undef ELPP_LITERAL
468 #undef ELPP_STRLEN
469 #undef ELPP_COUT
470 #if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
471 # define ELPP_LITERAL(txt) L##txt
472 # define ELPP_STRLEN wcslen
473 # if defined ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT
474 # define ELPP_COUT ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT
475 # else
476 # define ELPP_COUT std::wcout
477 # endif // defined ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT
478  typedef wchar_t char_t;
479  typedef std::wstring string_t;
480  typedef std::wstringstream stringstream_t;
481  typedef std::wfstream fstream_t;
482  typedef std::wostream ostream_t;
483 #else
484 # define ELPP_LITERAL(txt) txt
485 # define ELPP_STRLEN strlen
486 # if defined ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT
487 # define ELPP_COUT ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT
488 # else
489 # define ELPP_COUT std::cout
490 # endif // defined ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT
491  typedef char char_t;
492  typedef std::string string_t;
493  typedef std::stringstream stringstream_t;
494  typedef std::fstream fstream_t;
495  typedef std::ostream ostream_t;
496 #endif // defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
497 #if defined(ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT_LINE)
498 # define ELPP_COUT_LINE(logLine) ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT_LINE(logLine)
499 #else
500 # define ELPP_COUT_LINE(logLine) logLine << std::flush
501 #endif // defined(ELPP_CUSTOM_COUT_LINE)
502  typedef unsigned short EnumType;
503  typedef std::shared_ptr<base::Storage> StoragePointer;
504  typedef int VerboseLevel;
505  typedef std::shared_ptr<LogDispatchCallback> LogDispatchCallbackPtr;
506  typedef std::shared_ptr<PerformanceTrackingCallback> PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr;
507  } // namespace type
511  class NoCopy {
512  protected:
513  NoCopy(void) {}
514  private:
515  NoCopy(const NoCopy&);
516  NoCopy& operator=(const NoCopy&);
517  };
522  class StaticClass {
523  private:
524  StaticClass(void);
525  StaticClass(const StaticClass&);
526  StaticClass& operator=(const StaticClass&);
527  };
528  } // namespace base
533  enum class Level : base::type::EnumType {
535  Global = 1,
537  Trace = 2,
539  Debug = 4,
541  Fatal = 8,
543  Error = 16,
545  Warning = 32,
547  Verbose = 64,
549  Info = 128,
551  Unknown = 1010
552  };
554  class LevelHelper : base::StaticClass {
555  public:
557  static const base::type::EnumType kMinValid = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(Level::Trace);
559  static const base::type::EnumType kMaxValid = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(Level::Info);
561  static base::type::EnumType castToInt(Level level) {
562  return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(level);
563  }
565  static Level castFromInt(base::type::EnumType l) {
566  return static_cast<Level>(l);
567  }
570  static const char* convertToString(Level level) {
571  // Do not use switch over strongly typed enums because Intel C++ compilers dont support them yet.
572  if (level == Level::Global) return "GLOBAL";
573  if (level == Level::Debug) return "DEBUG";
574  if (level == Level::Info) return "INFO";
575  if (level == Level::Warning) return "WARNING";
576  if (level == Level::Error) return "ERROR";
577  if (level == Level::Fatal) return "FATAL";
578  if (level == Level::Verbose) return "VERBOSE";
579  if (level == Level::Trace) return "TRACE";
580  return "UNKNOWN";
581  }
585  static Level convertFromString(const char* levelStr) {
586  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "GLOBAL") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "global") == 0))
587  return Level::Global;
588  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "DEBUG") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "debug") == 0))
589  return Level::Debug;
590  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "INFO") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "info") == 0))
591  return Level::Info;
592  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "WARNING") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "warning") == 0))
593  return Level::Warning;
594  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "ERROR") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "error") == 0))
595  return Level::Error;
596  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "FATAL") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "fatal") == 0))
597  return Level::Fatal;
598  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "VERBOSE") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "verbose") == 0))
599  return Level::Verbose;
600  if ((strcmp(levelStr, "TRACE") == 0) || (strcmp(levelStr, "trace") == 0))
601  return Level::Trace;
602  return Level::Unknown;
603  }
608  static inline void forEachLevel(base::type::EnumType* startIndex, const std::function<bool(void)>& fn) {
609  base::type::EnumType lIndexMax = LevelHelper::kMaxValid;
610  do {
611  if (fn()) {
612  break;
613  }
614  *startIndex = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(*startIndex << 1);
615  } while (*startIndex <= lIndexMax);
616  }
617  };
620  enum class ConfigurationType : base::type::EnumType {
623  Enabled = 1,
625  ToFile = 2,
628  ToStandardOutput = 4,
630  Format = 8,
632  Filename = 16,
634  MillisecondsWidth = 32,
638  PerformanceTracking = 64,
643  MaxLogFileSize = 128,
645  LogFlushThreshold = 256,
647  Unknown = 1010
648  };
650  class ConfigurationTypeHelper : base::StaticClass {
651  public:
653  static const base::type::EnumType kMinValid = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(ConfigurationType::Enabled);
655  static const base::type::EnumType kMaxValid = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize);
657  static base::type::EnumType castToInt(ConfigurationType configurationType) {
658  return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(configurationType);
659  }
661  static ConfigurationType castFromInt(base::type::EnumType c) {
662  return static_cast<ConfigurationType>(c);
663  }
666  static const char* convertToString(ConfigurationType configurationType) {
667  // Do not use switch over strongly typed enums because Intel C++ compilers dont support them yet.
668  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::Enabled) return "ENABLED";
669  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::Filename) return "FILENAME";
670  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::Format) return "FORMAT";
671  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::ToFile) return "TO_FILE";
672  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput) return "TO_STANDARD_OUTPUT";
673  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth) return "MILLISECONDS_WIDTH";
674  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking) return "PERFORMANCE_TRACKING";
675  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize) return "MAX_LOG_FILE_SIZE";
676  if (configurationType == ConfigurationType::LogFlushThreshold) return "LOG_FLUSH_THRESHOLD";
677  return "UNKNOWN";
678  }
682  static ConfigurationType convertFromString(const char* configStr) {
683  if ((strcmp(configStr, "ENABLED") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "enabled") == 0))
684  return ConfigurationType::Enabled;
685  if ((strcmp(configStr, "TO_FILE") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "to_file") == 0))
686  return ConfigurationType::ToFile;
687  if ((strcmp(configStr, "TO_STANDARD_OUTPUT") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "to_standard_output") == 0))
688  return ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput;
689  if ((strcmp(configStr, "FORMAT") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "format") == 0))
690  return ConfigurationType::Format;
691  if ((strcmp(configStr, "FILENAME") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "filename") == 0))
692  return ConfigurationType::Filename;
693  if ((strcmp(configStr, "MILLISECONDS_WIDTH") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "milliseconds_width") == 0))
694  return ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth;
695  if ((strcmp(configStr, "PERFORMANCE_TRACKING") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "performance_tracking") == 0))
696  return ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking;
697  if ((strcmp(configStr, "MAX_LOG_FILE_SIZE") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "max_log_file_size") == 0))
698  return ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize;
699  if ((strcmp(configStr, "LOG_FLUSH_THRESHOLD") == 0) || (strcmp(configStr, "log_flush_threshold") == 0))
700  return ConfigurationType::LogFlushThreshold;
701  return ConfigurationType::Unknown;
702  }
708  static inline void forEachConfigType(base::type::EnumType* startIndex, const std::function<bool(void)>& fn) {
709  base::type::EnumType cIndexMax = ConfigurationTypeHelper::kMaxValid;
710  do {
711  if (fn()) {
712  break;
713  }
714  *startIndex = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(*startIndex << 1);
715  } while (*startIndex <= cIndexMax);
716  }
717  };
719  enum class LoggingFlag : base::type::EnumType {
721  NewLineForContainer = 1,
724  AllowVerboseIfModuleNotSpecified = 2,
726  LogDetailedCrashReason = 4,
728  DisableApplicationAbortOnFatalLog = 8,
730  ImmediateFlush = 16,
732  StrictLogFileSizeCheck = 32,
734  ColoredTerminalOutput = 64,
736  MultiLoggerSupport = 128,
738  DisablePerformanceTrackingCheckpointComparison = 256,
740  DisableVModules = 512,
742  DisableVModulesExtensions = 1024,
744  HierarchicalLogging = 2048,
746  CreateLoggerAutomatically = 4096,
748  AutoSpacing = 8192,
750  FixedTimeFormat = 16384
751  };
752  namespace base {
754  namespace consts {
755  // Level log values - These are values that are replaced in place of %level format specifier
756  static const base::type::char_t* kInfoLevelLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("INFO ");
757  static const base::type::char_t* kDebugLevelLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("DEBUG");
758  static const base::type::char_t* kWarningLevelLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("WARN ");
759  static const base::type::char_t* kErrorLevelLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("ERROR");
760  static const base::type::char_t* kFatalLevelLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("FATAL");
761  static const base::type::char_t* kVerboseLevelLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("VER");
762  static const base::type::char_t* kTraceLevelLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("TRACE");
763  static const base::type::char_t* kInfoLevelShortLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("I");
764  static const base::type::char_t* kDebugLevelShortLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("D");
765  static const base::type::char_t* kWarningLevelShortLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("W");
766  static const base::type::char_t* kErrorLevelShortLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("E");
767  static const base::type::char_t* kFatalLevelShortLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("F");
768  static const base::type::char_t* kVerboseLevelShortLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("V");
769  static const base::type::char_t* kTraceLevelShortLogValue = ELPP_LITERAL("T");

846  const struct {
847  double value;

849  } kTimeFormats[] = {
850  { 1000.0f, ELPP_LITERAL("mis") },
851  { 1000.0f, ELPP_LITERAL("ms") },
852  { 60.0f, ELPP_LITERAL("seconds") },
853  { 60.0f, ELPP_LITERAL("minutes") },
854  { 24.0f, ELPP_LITERAL("hours") },
855  { 7.0f, ELPP_LITERAL("days") }
856  };
857  static const int kTimeFormatsCount = sizeof(kTimeFormats) / sizeof(kTimeFormats[0]);
858  const struct {
859  int numb;
860  const char* name;
861  const char* brief;
862  const char* detail;
863  } kCrashSignals[] = {
864  // NOTE: Do not re-order, if you do please check CrashHandler(bool) constructor and CrashHandler::setHandler(..)
865  { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT", "Abnormal termination",
866  "Program was abnormally terminated." },
867  { SIGFPE, "SIGFPE", "Erroneous arithmetic operation",
868  "Arithemetic operation issue such as division by zero or operation resulting in overflow." },
869  { SIGILL, "SIGILL", "Illegal instruction",
870  "Generally due to a corruption in the code or to an attempt to execute data."},
871  { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV", "Invalid access to memory",
872  "Program is trying to read an invalid (unallocated, deleted or corrupted) or inaccessible memory." },
873  { SIGINT, "SIGINT", "Interactive attention signal",
874  "Interruption generated (generally) by user or operating system." },
875  };
876  static const int kCrashSignalsCount = sizeof(kCrashSignals) / sizeof(kCrashSignals[0]);
877  } // namespace consts
878  } // namespace base
879  typedef std::function<void(const char*, std::size_t)> PreRollOutCallback;
880  namespace base {
881  static inline void defaultPreRollOutCallback(const char*, std::size_t) {}
883  enum class TimestampUnit : base::type::EnumType {
884  Microsecond = 0, Millisecond = 1, Second = 2, Minute = 3, Hour = 4, Day = 5
885  };
887  enum class FormatFlags : base::type::EnumType {
888  DateTime = 1<<1, LoggerId = 1<<2, File = 1<<3, Line = 1<<4, Location = 1<<5, Function = 1<<6,
889  User = 1<<7, Host = 1<<8, LogMessage = 1<<9, VerboseLevel = 1<<10, AppName = 1<<11, ThreadId = 1<<12,
890  Level = 1<<13, FileBase = 1<<14, LevelShort = 1<<15
891  };
893  class MillisecondsWidth {
894  public:
895  MillisecondsWidth(void) { init(base::consts::kDefaultMillisecondsWidth); }
896  explicit MillisecondsWidth(int width) { init(width); }
897  bool operator==(const MillisecondsWidth& msWidth) { return m_width == msWidth.m_width && m_offset == msWidth.m_offset; }
898  int m_width; unsigned int m_offset;
899  private:
900  void init(int width) {
901  if (width < 1 || width > 6) {
902  width = base::consts::kDefaultMillisecondsWidth;
903  }
904  m_width = width;
905  switch (m_width) {
906  case 3: m_offset = 1000; break;
907  case 4: m_offset = 100; break;
908  case 5: m_offset = 10; break;
909  case 6: m_offset = 1; break;
910  default: m_offset = 1000; break;
911  }
912  }
913  };
915  namespace utils {
917  template <typename T>
918  static inline
919  typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<T*>::value, void>::type
920  safeDelete(T*& pointer) {
921  if (pointer == nullptr)
922  return;
923  delete pointer;
924  pointer = nullptr;
925  }
927  static inline const char* charPtrVal(const char* pointer) {
928  return pointer == nullptr ? base::consts::kNullPointer : pointer;
929  }
931  static inline void abort(int status, const std::string& reason = std::string()) {
932  // Both status and reason params are there for debugging with tools like gdb etc
933  ELPP_UNUSED(status);
934  ELPP_UNUSED(reason);
935 #if defined(ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC) && defined(_M_IX86) && defined(_DEBUG)
936  // Ignore msvc critical error dialog - break instead (on debug mode)
937  _asm int 3
938 #else
939  ::abort();
940 #endif // defined(ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC) && defined(_M_IX86) && defined(_DEBUG)
941  }
944  namespace bitwise {
945  template <typename Enum>
946  static inline base::type::EnumType And(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
947  return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(flag) & static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(e);
948  }
949  template <typename Enum>
950  static inline base::type::EnumType Not(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
951  return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(flag) & ~(static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(e));
952  }
953  template <typename Enum>
954  static inline base::type::EnumType Or(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
955  return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(flag) | static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(e);
956  }
957  } // namespace bitwise
958  template <typename Enum>
959  static inline void addFlag(Enum e, base::type::EnumType* flag) {
960  *flag = base::utils::bitwise::Or<Enum>(e, *flag);
961  }
962  template <typename Enum>
963  static inline void removeFlag(Enum e, base::type::EnumType* flag) {
964  *flag = base::utils::bitwise::Not<Enum>(e, *flag);
965  }
966  template <typename Enum>
967  static inline bool hasFlag(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
968  return base::utils::bitwise::And<Enum>(e, flag) > 0x0;
969  }
970  } // namespace utils
971  namespace threading {
972 #if ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED
973 # if !ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING
974  namespace internal {
976  class Mutex : base::NoCopy {
977  public:
978  Mutex(void) {
979 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX
980  pthread_mutex_init(&m_underlyingMutex, nullptr);
981 # elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
982  InitializeCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
983 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
984  }
985 
986  virtual ~Mutex(void) {
987 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX
988  pthread_mutex_destroy(&m_underlyingMutex);
989 # elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
990  DeleteCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
991 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
992  }
993 
994  inline void lock(void) {
995 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX
996  pthread_mutex_lock(&m_underlyingMutex);
997 # elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
998  EnterCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
999 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1000  }
1001 
1002  inline bool try_lock(void) {
1003 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1004  return (pthread_mutex_trylock(&m_underlyingMutex) == 0);
1005 # elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1006  return TryEnterCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
1007 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1008  }
1009 
1010  inline void unlock(void) {
1011 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1012  pthread_mutex_unlock(&m_underlyingMutex);
1013 # elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1014  LeaveCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
1015 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1016  }
1017 
1018  private:
1019 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1020  pthread_mutex_t m_underlyingMutex;
1021 # elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1022  CRITICAL_SECTION m_underlyingMutex;
1023 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1024  };
1026  template <typename M>
1027  class ScopedLock : base::NoCopy {
1028  public:
1029  explicit ScopedLock(M& mutex) {
1030  m_mutex = &mutex;
1031  m_mutex->lock();
1032  }
1033 
1034  virtual ~ScopedLock(void) {
1035  m_mutex->unlock();
1036  }
1037  private:
1038  M* m_mutex;
1039  ScopedLock(void);
1040  };
1041  } // namespace internal
1043  static inline std::string getCurrentThreadId(void) {
1044  std::stringstream ss;
1045 # if (ELPP_OS_WINDOWS)
1046  ss << GetCurrentThreadId();
1047 # endif // (ELPP_OS_WINDOWS)
1048  return ss.str();
1049  }
1050  static inline void msleep(int) {
1051  // No implementation for non std::thread version
1052  }
1053  typedef base::threading::internal::Mutex Mutex;
1054  typedef base::threading::internal::ScopedLock<base::threading::Mutex> ScopedLock;
1055 # else
1056  static inline std::string getCurrentThreadId(void) {
1058  std::stringstream ss;
1059  ss << std::this_thread::get_id();
1060  return ss.str();
1061  }
1062  static inline void msleep(int ms) {
1063  // Only when async logging enabled - this is because async is strict on compiler
1064 # if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
1065 # if defined(ELPP_NO_SLEEP_FOR)
1066  usleep(ms * 1000);
1067 # else
1068  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(ms));
1069 # endif // defined(ELPP_NO_SLEEP_FOR)
1070 # else
1071  ELPP_UNUSED(ms);
1072 # endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
1073  }
1074  typedef std::mutex Mutex;
1075  typedef std::lock_guard<std::mutex> ScopedLock;
1076 # endif // !ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING
1077 #else
1078  namespace internal {
1080  class NoMutex : base::NoCopy {
1081  public:
1082  NoMutex(void) {}
1083  inline void lock(void) {}
1084  inline bool try_lock(void) { return true; }
1085  inline void unlock(void) {}
1086  };
1088  template <typename Mutex>
1089  class NoScopedLock : base::NoCopy {
1090  public:
1091  explicit NoScopedLock(Mutex&) {
1092  }
1093  virtual ~NoScopedLock(void) {
1094  }
1095  private:
1096  NoScopedLock(void);
1097  };
1098  } // namespace internal
1099  static inline std::string getCurrentThreadId(void) {
1100  return std::string();
1101  }
1102  static inline void msleep(int) {
1103  // No custom implementation
1104  }
1105  typedef base::threading::internal::NoMutex Mutex;
1106  typedef base::threading::internal::NoScopedLock<base::threading::Mutex> ScopedLock;
1107 #endif // ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED
1108  class ThreadSafe {
1110  public:
1111  virtual inline void acquireLock(void) ELPP_FINAL { m_mutex.lock(); }
1112  virtual inline void releaseLock(void) ELPP_FINAL { m_mutex.unlock(); }
1113  virtual inline base::threading::Mutex& lock(void) ELPP_FINAL { return m_mutex; }
1114  protected:
1115  ThreadSafe(void) {}
1116  virtual ~ThreadSafe(void) {}
1117  private:
1118  base::threading::Mutex m_mutex;
1119  };
1120  } // namespace threading
1121  namespace utils {
1122  class File : base::StaticClass {
1123  public:
1126  static base::type::fstream_t* newFileStream(const std::string& filename) {
1127  base::type::fstream_t *fs = new base::type::fstream_t(filename.c_str(),
1128  base::type::fstream_t::out
1129 #if !defined(ELPP_FRESH_LOG_FILE)
1130  | base::type::fstream_t::app
1131 #endif
1132  );
1133 #if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
1134  std::locale elppUnicodeLocale("");
1135 # if ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1136  std::locale elppUnicodeLocaleWindows(elppUnicodeLocale, new std::codecvt_utf8_utf16<wchar_t>);
1137  elppUnicodeLocale = elppUnicodeLocaleWindows;
1138 # endif // ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1139  fs->imbue(elppUnicodeLocale);
1140 #endif // defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
1141  if (fs->is_open()) {
1142  fs->flush();
1143  } else {
1144  base::utils::safeDelete(fs);
1145  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Bad file [" << filename << "]", true);
1146  }
1147  return fs;
1148  }
1149 
1151  static std::size_t getSizeOfFile(base::type::fstream_t* fs) {
1152  if (fs == nullptr) {
1153  return 0;
1154  }
1155  std::streampos currPos = fs->tellg();
1156  fs->seekg(0, fs->end);
1157  std::size_t size = static_cast<std::size_t>(fs->tellg());
1158  fs->seekg(currPos);
1159  return size;
1160  }
1161 
1163  static inline bool pathExists(const char* path, bool considerFile = false) {
1164  if (path == nullptr) {
1165  return false;
1166  }
1167 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1168  ELPP_UNUSED(considerFile);
1169  struct stat st;
1170  return (stat(path, &st) == 0);
1171 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1172  DWORD fileType = GetFileAttributesA(path);
1173  if (fileType == INVALID_FILE_ATTRIBUTES) {
1174  return false;
1175  }
1176  return considerFile ? true : ((fileType & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) == 0 ? false : true);
1177 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1178  }
1179 
1182  static bool createPath(const std::string& path) {
1183  if (path.empty()) {
1184  return false;
1185  }
1186  if (base::utils::File::pathExists(path.c_str())) {
1187  return true;
1188  }
1189  int status = -1;
1190 
1191  char* currPath = const_cast<char*>(path.c_str());
1192  std::string builtPath = std::string();
1193 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1194  if (path[0] == '/') {
1195  builtPath = "/";
1196  }
1197  currPath = STRTOK(currPath, base::consts::kFilePathSeperator, 0);
1198 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1199  // Use secure functions API
1200  char* nextTok_ = nullptr;
1201  currPath = STRTOK(currPath, base::consts::kFilePathSeperator, &nextTok_);
1202  ELPP_UNUSED(nextTok_);
1203 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1204  while (currPath != nullptr) {
1205  builtPath.append(currPath);
1206  builtPath.append(base::consts::kFilePathSeperator);
1207 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1208  status = mkdir(builtPath.c_str(), ELPP_LOG_PERMS);
1209  currPath = STRTOK(nullptr, base::consts::kFilePathSeperator, 0);
1210 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1211  status = _mkdir(builtPath.c_str());
1212  currPath = STRTOK(nullptr, base::consts::kFilePathSeperator, &nextTok_);
1213 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1214  }
1215  if (status == -1) {
1216  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Error while creating path [" << path << "]", true);
1217  return false;
1218  }
1219  return true;
1220  }
1222  static std::string extractPathFromFilename(const std::string& fullPath,
1223  const char* seperator = base::consts::kFilePathSeperator) {
1224  if ((fullPath == "") || (fullPath.find(seperator) == std::string::npos)) {
1225  return fullPath;
1226  }
1227  std::size_t lastSlashAt = fullPath.find_last_of(seperator);
1228  if (lastSlashAt == 0) {
1229  return std::string(seperator);
1230  }
1231  return fullPath.substr(0, lastSlashAt + 1);
1232  }
1234  static void buildStrippedFilename(const char* filename, char buff[],
1235  std::size_t limit = base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength) {
1236  std::size_t sizeOfFilename = strlen(filename);
1237  if (sizeOfFilename >= limit) {
1238  filename += (sizeOfFilename - limit);
1239  if (filename[0] != '.' && filename[1] != '.') { // prepend if not already
1240  filename += 3; // 3 = '..'
1241  STRCAT(buff, "..", limit);
1242  }
1243  }
1244  STRCAT(buff, filename, limit);
1245  }
1247  static void buildBaseFilename(const std::string& fullPath, char buff[],
1248  std::size_t limit = base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength,
1249  const char* seperator = base::consts::kFilePathSeperator) {
1250  const char *filename = fullPath.c_str();
1251  std::size_t lastSlashAt = fullPath.find_last_of(seperator);
1252  filename += lastSlashAt ? lastSlashAt+1 : 0;
1253  std::size_t sizeOfFilename = strlen(filename);
1254  if (sizeOfFilename >= limit) {
1255  filename += (sizeOfFilename - limit);
1256  if (filename[0] != '.' && filename[1] != '.') { // prepend if not already
1257  filename += 3; // 3 = '..'
1258  STRCAT(buff, "..", limit);
1259  }
1260  }
1261  STRCAT(buff, filename, limit);
1262  }
1263  };
1265  class Str : base::StaticClass {
1266  public:
1268  static inline bool isDigit(char c) {
1269  return c >= '0' && c <= '9';
1270  }
1271 
1273  static bool wildCardMatch(const char* str, const char* pattern) {
1274  while (*pattern) {
1275  switch (*pattern) {
1276  case '?':
1277  if (!*str)
1278  return false;
1279  ++str;
1280  ++pattern;
1281  break;
1282  case '*':
1283  if (wildCardMatch(str, pattern + 1))
1284  return true;
1285  if (*str && wildCardMatch(str + 1, pattern))
1286  return true;
1287  return false;
1288  default:
1289  if (*str++ != *pattern++)
1290  return false;
1291  break;
1292  }
1293  }
1294  return !*str && !*pattern;
1295  }
1296 
1299  static inline std::string& ltrim(std::string& str) {
1300  str.erase(str.begin(), std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), std::not1(std::ptr_fun<int, int>(&std::isspace))));
1301  return str;
1302  }
1303 
1306  static inline std::string& rtrim(std::string& str) {
1307  str.erase(std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), std::not1(std::ptr_fun<int, int>(&std::isspace))).base(), str.end());
1308  return str;
1309  }
1310 
1313  static inline std::string& trim(std::string& str) {
1314  return ltrim(rtrim(str));
1315  }
1316 
1321  static inline bool startsWith(const std::string& str, const std::string& start) {
1322  return (str.length() >= start.length()) && (str.compare(0, start.length(), start) == 0);
1323  }
1324 
1329  static inline bool endsWith(const std::string& str, const std::string& end) {
1330  return (str.length() >= end.length()) && (str.compare(str.length() - end.length(), end.length(), end) == 0);
1331  }
1332 
1338  static inline std::string& replaceAll(std::string& str, char replaceWhat, char replaceWith) {
1339  std::replace(str.begin(), str.end(), replaceWhat, replaceWith);
1340  return str;
1341  }
1342 
1348  static inline std::string& replaceAll(std::string& str, const std::string& replaceWhat, // NOLINT
1349  const std::string& replaceWith) {
1350  if (replaceWhat == replaceWith)
1351  return str;
1352  std::size_t foundAt = std::string::npos;
1353  while ((foundAt = str.find(replaceWhat, foundAt + 1)) != std::string::npos) {
1354  str.replace(foundAt, replaceWhat.length(), replaceWith);
1355  }
1356  return str;
1357  }
1358 
1359  static void replaceFirstWithEscape(base::type::string_t& str, const base::type::string_t& replaceWhat, // NOLINT
1360  const base::type::string_t& replaceWith) {
1361  std::size_t foundAt = base::type::string_t::npos;
1362  while ((foundAt = str.find(replaceWhat, foundAt + 1)) != base::type::string_t::npos) {
1363  if (foundAt > 0 && str[foundAt - 1] == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
1364  str.erase(foundAt > 0 ? foundAt - 1 : 0, 1);
1365  ++foundAt;
1366  } else {
1367  str.replace(foundAt, replaceWhat.length(), replaceWith);
1368  return;
1369  }
1370  }
1371  }
1372 #if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
1373  static void replaceFirstWithEscape(base::type::string_t& str, const base::type::string_t& replaceWhat, // NOLINT
1374  const std::string& replaceWith) {
1375  replaceFirstWithEscape(str, replaceWhat, base::type::string_t(replaceWith.begin(), replaceWith.end()));
1376  }
1377 #endif // defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
1378  static inline std::string& toUpper(std::string& str) {
1382  std::transform(str.begin(), str.end(), str.begin(), ::toupper);
1383  return str;
1384  }
1385 
1387  static inline bool cStringEq(const char* s1, const char* s2) {
1388  if (s1 == nullptr && s2 == nullptr) return true;
1389  if (s1 == nullptr || s2 == nullptr) return false;
1390  return strcmp(s1, s2) == 0;
1391  }
1392 
1395  static bool cStringCaseEq(const char* s1, const char* s2) {
1396  if (s1 == nullptr && s2 == nullptr) return true;
1397  if (s1 == nullptr || s2 == nullptr) return false;
1398  if (strlen(s1) != strlen(s2)) return false;
1399  while (*s1 != '\0' && *s2 != '\0') {
1400  if (::toupper(*s1) != ::toupper(*s2)) return false;
1401  ++s1;
1402  ++s2;
1403  }
1404  return true;
1405  }
1406 
1408  static inline bool contains(const char* str, char c) {
1409  for (; *str; ++str) {
1410  if (*str == c)
1411  return true;
1412  }
1413  return false;
1414  }
1415 
1416  static inline char* convertAndAddToBuff(std::size_t n, int len, char* buf, const char* bufLim, bool zeroPadded = true) {
1417  char localBuff[10] = "";
1418  char* p = localBuff + sizeof(localBuff) - 2;
1419  if (n > 0) {
1420  for (; n > 0 && p > localBuff && len > 0; n /= 10, --len)
1421  *--p = static_cast<char>(n % 10 + '0');
1422  } else {
1423  *--p = '0';
1424  --len;
1425  }
1426  if (zeroPadded)
1427  while (p > localBuff && len-- > 0) *--p = static_cast<char>('0');
1428  return addToBuff(p, buf, bufLim);
1429  }
1430 
1431  static inline char* addToBuff(const char* str, char* buf, const char* bufLim) {
1432  while ((buf < bufLim) && ((*buf = *str++) != '\0'))
1433  ++buf;
1434  return buf;
1435  }
1436 
1437  static inline char* clearBuff(char buff[], std::size_t lim) {
1438  STRCPY(buff, "", lim);
1439  ELPP_UNUSED(lim); // For *nix we dont have anything using lim in above STRCPY macro
1440  return buff;
1441  }
1442 
1445  static char* wcharPtrToCharPtr(const wchar_t* line) {
1446  std::size_t len_ = wcslen(line) + 1;
1447  char* buff_ = static_cast<char*>(malloc(len_ + 1));
1448 # if ELPP_OS_UNIX || (ELPP_OS_WINDOWS && !ELPP_CRT_DBG_WARNINGS)
1449  std::wcstombs(buff_, line, len_);
1450 # elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1451  std::size_t convCount_ = 0;
1452  mbstate_t mbState_;
1453  ::memset(static_cast<void*>(&mbState_), 0, sizeof(mbState_));
1454  wcsrtombs_s(&convCount_, buff_, len_, &line, len_, &mbState_);
1455 # endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX || (ELPP_OS_WINDOWS && !ELPP_CRT_DBG_WARNINGS)
1456  return buff_;
1457  }
1458  };
1460  class OS : base::StaticClass {
1461  public:
1462 #if ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1463  static const char* getWindowsEnvironmentVariable(const char* varname) {
1468  const DWORD bufferLen = 50;
1469  static char buffer[bufferLen];
1470  if (GetEnvironmentVariableA(varname, buffer, bufferLen)) {
1471  return buffer;
1472  }
1473  return nullptr;
1474  }
1475 #endif // ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1476 #if ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1477  static inline std::string getProperty(const char* prop) {
1479  char propVal[PROP_VALUE_MAX + 1];
1480  int ret = __system_property_get(prop, propVal);
1481  return ret == 0 ? std::string() : std::string(propVal);
1482  }
1483 
1485  static std::string getDeviceName(void) {
1486  std::stringstream ss;
1487  std::string manufacturer = getProperty("ro.product.manufacturer");
1488  std::string model = getProperty("ro.product.model");
1489  if (manufacturer.empty() || model.empty()) {
1490  return std::string();
1491  }
1492  ss << manufacturer << "-" << model;
1493  return ss.str();
1494  }
1495 #endif // ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1496 
1502  static const std::string getBashOutput(const char* command) {
1503 #if (ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_ANDROID && !ELPP_CYGWIN)
1504  if (command == nullptr) {
1505  return std::string();
1506  }
1507  FILE* proc = nullptr;
1508  if ((proc = popen(command, "r")) == nullptr) {
1509  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("\nUnable to run command [" << command << "]", true);
1510  return std::string();
1511  }
1512  char hBuff[4096];
1513  if (fgets(hBuff, sizeof(hBuff), proc) != nullptr) {
1514  pclose(proc);
1515  if (hBuff[strlen(hBuff) - 1] == '\n') {
1516  hBuff[strlen(hBuff) - 1] = '\0';
1517  }
1518  return std::string(hBuff);
1519  }
1520  return std::string();
1521 #else
1522  ELPP_UNUSED(command);
1523  return std::string();
1524 #endif // (ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_ANDROID && !ELPP_CYGWIN)
1525  }
1526 
1532  static std::string getEnvironmentVariable(const char* variableName, const char* defaultVal, const char* alternativeBashCommand = nullptr) {
1533 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1534  const char* val = getenv(variableName);
1535 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1536  const char* val = getWindowsEnvironmentVariable(variableName);
1537 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1538  if ((val == nullptr) || ((strcmp(val, "") == 0))) {
1539 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX && defined(ELPP_FORCE_ENV_VAR_FROM_BASH)
1540  // Try harder on unix-based systems
1541  std::string valBash = base::utils::OS::getBashOutput(alternativeBashCommand);
1542  if (valBash.empty()) {
1543  return std::string(defaultVal);
1544  } else {
1545  return valBash;
1546  }
1547 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS || ELPP_OS_UNIX
1548  ELPP_UNUSED(alternativeBashCommand);
1549  return std::string(defaultVal);
1550 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX && defined(ELPP_FORCE_ENV_VAR_FROM_BASH)
1551  }
1552  return std::string(val);
1553  }
1555  static inline std::string currentUser(void) {
1556 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1557  return getEnvironmentVariable("USER", base::consts::kUnknownUser, "whoami");
1558 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1559  return getEnvironmentVariable("USERNAME", base::consts::kUnknownUser);
1560 #elif ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1561  ELPP_UNUSED(base::consts::kUnknownUser);
1562  return std::string("android");
1563 #else
1564  return std::string();
1565 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1566  }
1567 
1571  static inline std::string currentHost(void) {
1572 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1573  return getEnvironmentVariable("HOSTNAME", base::consts::kUnknownHost, "hostname");
1574 #elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1575  return getEnvironmentVariable("COMPUTERNAME", base::consts::kUnknownHost);
1576 #elif ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1577  ELPP_UNUSED(base::consts::kUnknownHost);
1578  return getDeviceName();
1579 #else
1580  return std::string();
1581 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX && !ELPP_OS_ANDROID
1582  }
1584  static inline bool termSupportsColor(void) {
1585  std::string term = getEnvironmentVariable("TERM", "");
1586  return term == "xterm" || term == "xterm-color" || term == "xterm-256color"
1587  || term == "screen" || term == "linux" || term == "cygwin"
1588  || term == "screen-256color";
1589  }
1590  };
1591  extern std::string s_currentUser;
1592  extern std::string s_currentHost;
1593  extern bool s_termSupportsColor;
1594 #define ELPP_INITI_BASIC_DECLR \
1595 namespace el {\
1596 namespace base {\
1597 namespace utils {\
1598 std::string s_currentUser = el::base::utils::OS::currentUser(); \
1599 std::string s_currentHost = el::base::utils::OS::currentHost(); \
1600 bool s_termSupportsColor = el::base::utils::OS::termSupportsColor(); \
1601 }\
1602 }\
1603 }
1604  class DateTime : base::StaticClass {
1606  public:
1611  static void gettimeofday(struct timeval* tv) {
1612 #if ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1613  if (tv != nullptr) {
1614 # if ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC || defined(_MSC_EXTENSIONS)
1615  const unsigned __int64 delta_ = 11644473600000000Ui64;
1616 # else
1617  const unsigned __int64 delta_ = 11644473600000000ULL;
1618 # endif // ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC || defined(_MSC_EXTENSIONS)
1619  const double secOffSet = 0.000001;
1620  const unsigned long usecOffSet = 1000000;
1621  FILETIME fileTime;
1622  GetSystemTimeAsFileTime(&fileTime);
1623  unsigned __int64 present = 0;
1624  present |= fileTime.dwHighDateTime;
1625  present = present << 32;
1626  present |= fileTime.dwLowDateTime;
1627  present /= 10; // mic-sec
1628  // Subtract the difference
1629  present -= delta_;
1630  tv->tv_sec = static_cast<long>(present * secOffSet);
1631  tv->tv_usec = static_cast<long>(present % usecOffSet);
1632  }
1633 #else
1634  ::gettimeofday(tv, nullptr);
1635 #endif // ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
1636  }
1637 
1642  static inline std::string getDateTime(const char* format, const base::MillisecondsWidth* msWidth) {
1643  struct timeval currTime;
1644  gettimeofday(&currTime);
1645  struct ::tm timeInfo;
1646  buildTimeInfo(&currTime, &timeInfo);
1647  const int kBuffSize = 30;
1648  char buff_[kBuffSize] = "";
1649  parseFormat(buff_, kBuffSize, format, &timeInfo, static_cast<std::size_t>(currTime.tv_usec / msWidth->m_offset), msWidth);
1650  return std::string(buff_);
1651  }
1652 
1654  static base::type::string_t formatTime(unsigned long long time, base::TimestampUnit timestampUnit) {
1655  double result = static_cast<double>(time);
1656  base::type::EnumType start = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(timestampUnit);
1657  const base::type::char_t* unit = base::consts::kTimeFormats[start].unit;
1658  for (base::type::EnumType i = start; i < base::consts::kTimeFormatsCount - 1; ++i) {
1659  if (result <= base::consts::kTimeFormats[i].value) {
1660  break;
1661  }
1662  result /= base::consts::kTimeFormats[i].value;
1663  unit = base::consts::kTimeFormats[i + 1].unit;
1664  }
1665  base::type::stringstream_t ss;
1666  ss << result << " " << unit;
1667  return ss.str();
1668  }
1669 
1671  static inline unsigned long long getTimeDifference(const struct timeval& endTime, const struct timeval& startTime, base::TimestampUnit timestampUnit) {
1672  if (timestampUnit == base::TimestampUnit::Microsecond) {
1673  return static_cast<unsigned long long>(static_cast<unsigned long long>(1000000 * endTime.tv_sec + endTime.tv_usec) -
1674  static_cast<unsigned long long>(1000000 * startTime.tv_sec + startTime.tv_usec));
1675  } else {
1676  return static_cast<unsigned long long>((((endTime.tv_sec - startTime.tv_sec) * 1000000) + (endTime.tv_usec - startTime.tv_usec)) / 1000);
1677  }
1678  }
1679 
1680  private:
1681  static inline struct ::tm* buildTimeInfo(struct timeval* currTime, struct ::tm* timeInfo) {
1682 #if ELPP_OS_UNIX
1683  time_t rawTime = currTime->tv_sec;
1684  ::localtime_r(&rawTime, timeInfo);
1685  return timeInfo;
1686 #else
1687 # if ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
1688  ELPP_UNUSED(currTime);
1689  time_t t;
1690  _time64(&t);
1691  localtime_s(timeInfo, &t);
1692  return timeInfo;
1693 # else
1694  // For any other compilers that don't have CRT warnings issue e.g, MinGW or TDM GCC- we use different method
1695  time_t rawTime = currTime->tv_sec;
1696  struct tm* tmInf = localtime(&rawTime);
1697  *timeInfo = *tmInf;
1698  return timeInfo;
1699 # endif // ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
1700 #endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
1701  }
1702  static char* parseFormat(char* buf, std::size_t bufSz, const char* format, const struct tm* tInfo,
1703  std::size_t msec, const base::MillisecondsWidth* msWidth) {
1704  const char* bufLim = buf + bufSz;
1705  for (; *format; ++format) {
1706  if (*format == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
1707  switch (*++format) {
1708  case base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar: // Escape
1709  break;
1710  case '\0': // End
1711  --format;
1712  break;
1713  case 'd': // Day
1714  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_mday, 2, buf, bufLim);
1715  continue;
1716  case 'a': // Day of week (short)
1717  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(base::consts::kDaysAbbrev[tInfo->tm_wday], buf, bufLim);
1718  continue;
1719  case 'A': // Day of week (long)
1720  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(base::consts::kDays[tInfo->tm_wday], buf, bufLim);
1721  continue;
1722  case 'M': // month
1723  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_mon + 1, 2, buf, bufLim);
1724  continue;
1725  case 'b': // month (short)
1726  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(base::consts::kMonthsAbbrev[tInfo->tm_mon], buf, bufLim);
1727  continue;
1728  case 'B': // month (long)
1729  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(base::consts::kMonths[tInfo->tm_mon], buf, bufLim);
1730  continue;
1731  case 'y': // year (two digits)
1732  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_year + base::consts::kYearBase, 2, buf, bufLim);
1733  continue;
1734  case 'Y': // year (four digits)
1735  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_year + base::consts::kYearBase, 4, buf, bufLim);
1736  continue;
1737  case 'h': // hour (12-hour)
1738  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_hour % 12, 2, buf, bufLim);
1739  continue;
1740  case 'H': // hour (24-hour)
1741  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_hour, 2, buf, bufLim);
1742  continue;
1743  case 'm': // minute
1744  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_min, 2, buf, bufLim);
1745  continue;
1746  case 's': // second
1747  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(tInfo->tm_sec, 2, buf, bufLim);
1748  continue;
1749  case 'z': // milliseconds
1750  case 'g':
1751  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(msec, msWidth->m_width, buf, bufLim);
1752  continue;
1753  case 'F': // AM/PM
1754  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff((tInfo->tm_hour >= 12) ? base::consts::kPm : base::consts::kAm, buf, bufLim);
1755  continue;
1756  default:
1757  continue;
1758  }
1759  }
1760  if (buf == bufLim) break;
1761  *buf++ = *format;
1762  }
1763  return buf;
1764  }
1765  };
1767  class CommandLineArgs {
1768  public:
1769  CommandLineArgs(void) {
1770  setArgs(0, static_cast<char**>(nullptr));
1771  }
1772  CommandLineArgs(int argc, const char** argv) {
1773  setArgs(argc, argv);
1774  }
1775  CommandLineArgs(int argc, char** argv) {
1776  setArgs(argc, argv);
1777  }
1778  virtual ~CommandLineArgs(void) {}
1780  inline void setArgs(int argc, const char** argv) {
1781  setArgs(argc, const_cast<char**>(argv));
1782  }
1784  inline void setArgs(int argc, char** argv) {
1785  m_params.clear();
1786  m_paramsWithValue.clear();
1787  if (argc == 0 || argv == nullptr) {
1788  return;
1789  }
1790  m_argc = argc;
1791  m_argv = argv;
1792  for (int i = 1; i < m_argc; ++i) {
1793  const char* v = (strstr(m_argv[i], "="));
1794  if (v != nullptr && strlen(v) > 0) {
1795  std::string key = std::string(m_argv[i]);
1796  key = key.substr(0, key.find_first_of('='));
1797  if (hasParamWithValue(key.c_str())) {
1798  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Skipping [" << key << "] arg since it already has value ["
1799  << getParamValue(key.c_str()) << "]");
1800  } else {
1801  m_paramsWithValue.insert(std::make_pair(key, std::string(v + 1)));
1802  }
1803  }
1804  if (v == nullptr) {
1805  if (hasParam(m_argv[i])) {
1806  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Skipping [" << m_argv[i] << "] arg since it already exists");
1807  } else {
1808  m_params.push_back(std::string(m_argv[i]));
1809  }
1810  }
1811  }
1812  }
1814  inline bool hasParamWithValue(const char* paramKey) const {
1815  return m_paramsWithValue.find(std::string(paramKey)) != m_paramsWithValue.end();
1816  }
1819  inline const char* getParamValue(const char* paramKey) const {
1820  return m_paramsWithValue.find(std::string(paramKey))->second.c_str();
1821  }
1823  inline bool hasParam(const char* paramKey) const {
1824  return std::find(m_params.begin(), m_params.end(), std::string(paramKey)) != m_params.end();
1825  }
1827  inline bool empty(void) const {
1828  return m_params.empty() && m_paramsWithValue.empty();
1829  }
1831  inline std::size_t size(void) const {
1832  return m_params.size() + m_paramsWithValue.size();
1833  }
1834  inline friend base::type::ostream_t& operator<<(base::type::ostream_t& os, const CommandLineArgs& c) {
1835  for (int i = 1; i < c.m_argc; ++i) {
1836  os << ELPP_LITERAL("[") << c.m_argv[i] << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
1837  if (i < c.m_argc - 1) {
1838  os << ELPP_LITERAL(" ");
1839  }
1840  }
1841  return os;
1842  }
1843 
1844  private:
1845  int m_argc;
1846  char** m_argv;
1847  std::map<std::string, std::string> m_paramsWithValue;
1848  std::vector<std::string> m_params;
1849  };
1856  template <typename T_Ptr, typename Container>
1857  class AbstractRegistry : public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
1858  public:
1859  typedef typename Container::iterator iterator;
1860  typedef typename Container::const_iterator const_iterator;
1861 
1863  AbstractRegistry(void) {}
1864 
1866  AbstractRegistry(AbstractRegistry&& sr) {
1867  if (this == &sr) {
1868  return;
1869  }
1870  unregisterAll();
1871  m_list = std::move(sr.m_list);
1872  }
1873 
1874  bool operator==(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>& other) {
1875  if (size() != other.size()) {
1876  return false;
1877  }
1878  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < m_list.size(); ++i) {
1879  if (m_list.at(i) != other.m_list.at(i)) {
1880  return false;
1881  }
1882  }
1883  return true;
1884  }
1885 
1886  bool operator!=(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>& other) {
1887  if (size() != other.size()) {
1888  return true;
1889  }
1890  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < m_list.size(); ++i) {
1891  if (m_list.at(i) != other.m_list.at(i)) {
1892  return true;
1893  }
1894  }
1895  return false;
1896  }
1897 
1899  AbstractRegistry& operator=(AbstractRegistry&& sr) {
1900  if (this == &sr) {
1901  return *this;
1902  }
1903  unregisterAll();
1904  m_list = std::move(sr.m_list);
1905  return *this;
1906  }
1907 
1908  virtual ~AbstractRegistry(void) {
1909  }
1910 
1912  virtual inline iterator begin(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1913  return m_list.begin();
1914  }
1915 
1917  virtual inline iterator end(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1918  return m_list.end();
1919  }
1920 
1921 
1923  virtual inline const_iterator cbegin(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1924  return m_list.cbegin();
1925  }
1926 
1928  virtual inline const_iterator cend(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1929  return m_list.cend();
1930  }
1931 
1933  virtual inline bool empty(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1934  return m_list.empty();
1935  }
1936 
1938  virtual inline std::size_t size(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1939  return m_list.size();
1940  }
1941 
1943  virtual inline Container& list(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1944  return m_list;
1945  }
1946 
1948  virtual inline const Container& list(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1949  return m_list;
1950  }
1951 
1953  virtual void unregisterAll(void) = 0;
1954 
1955 protected:
1956  virtual void deepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>&) = 0;
1957  void reinitDeepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>& sr) {
1958  unregisterAll();
1959  deepCopy(sr);
1960  }
1961 
1962 private:
1963  Container m_list;
1964 };
1965 
1971 template <typename T_Ptr, typename T_Key = const char*>
1972 class Registry : public AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::map<T_Key, T_Ptr*>> {
1973 public:
1974  typedef typename Registry<T_Ptr, T_Key>::iterator iterator;
1975  typedef typename Registry<T_Ptr, T_Key>::const_iterator const_iterator;
1976 
1977  Registry(void) {}
1978 
1980  Registry(const Registry& sr) : AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>>() {
1981  if (this == &sr) {
1982  return;
1983  }
1984  this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
1985  }
1986 
1990  Registry& operator=(const Registry& sr) {
1991  if (this == &sr) {
1992  return *this;
1993  }
1994  this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
1995  return *this;
1996  }
1997 
1998  virtual ~Registry(void) {
1999  unregisterAll();
2000  }
2001 
2002 protected:
2003  virtual inline void unregisterAll(void) ELPP_FINAL {
2004  if (!this->empty()) {
2005  for (auto&& curr : this->list()) {
2006  base::utils::safeDelete(curr.second);
2007  }
2008  this->list().clear();
2009  }
2010 }
2011 
2013 virtual inline void registerNew(const T_Key& uniqKey, T_Ptr* ptr) ELPP_FINAL {
2014 unregister(uniqKey);
2015 this->list().insert(std::make_pair(uniqKey, ptr));
2016 }
2017 
2019 inline void unregister(const T_Key& uniqKey) {
2020  T_Ptr* existing = get(uniqKey);
2021  if (existing != nullptr) {
2022  base::utils::safeDelete(existing);
2023  this->list().erase(uniqKey);
2024  }
2025 }
2026 
2028 inline T_Ptr* get(const T_Key& uniqKey) {
2029  iterator it = this->list().find(uniqKey);
2030  return it == this->list().end()
2031  ? nullptr
2032  : it->second;
2033 }
2034 
2035 private:
2036 virtual inline void deepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::map<T_Key, T_Ptr*>>& sr) ELPP_FINAL {
2037 for (const_iterator it = sr.cbegin(); it != sr.cend(); ++it) {
2038  registerNew(it->first, new T_Ptr(*it->second));
2039 }
2040 }
2041 };
2042 
2047 template <typename T_Ptr, typename Pred>
2048 class RegistryWithPred : public AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>> {
2049 public:
2050  typedef typename RegistryWithPred<T_Ptr, Pred>::iterator iterator;
2051  typedef typename RegistryWithPred<T_Ptr, Pred>::const_iterator const_iterator;
2052 
2053  RegistryWithPred(void) {
2054  }
2055 
2056  virtual ~RegistryWithPred(void) {
2057  unregisterAll();
2058  }
2059 
2061  RegistryWithPred(const RegistryWithPred& sr) : AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>>() {
2062  if (this == &sr) {
2063  return;
2064  }
2065  this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
2066  }
2067 
2071  RegistryWithPred& operator=(const RegistryWithPred& sr) {
2072  if (this == &sr) {
2073  return *this;
2074  }
2075  this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
2076  return *this;
2077  }
2078 
2079  friend inline base::type::ostream_t& operator<<(base::type::ostream_t& os, const RegistryWithPred& sr) {
2080  for (const_iterator it = sr.list().begin(); it != sr.list().end(); ++it) {
2081  os << ELPP_LITERAL(" ") << **it << ELPP_LITERAL("\n");
2082  }
2083  return os;
2084  }
2085 
2086 protected:
2087  virtual inline void unregisterAll(void) ELPP_FINAL {
2088  if (!this->empty()) {
2089  for (auto&& curr : this->list()) {
2090  base::utils::safeDelete(curr);
2091  }
2092  this->list().clear();
2093  }
2094 }
2095 
2096 virtual void unregister(T_Ptr*& ptr) ELPP_FINAL {
2097 if (ptr) {
2098  iterator iter = this->begin();
2099  for (; iter != this->end(); ++iter) {
2100  if (ptr == *iter) {
2101  break;
2102  }
2103  }
2104  if (iter != this->end() && *iter != nullptr) {
2105  this->list().erase(iter);
2106  base::utils::safeDelete(*iter);
2107  }
2108 }
2109 }
2110 
2111 virtual inline void registerNew(T_Ptr* ptr) ELPP_FINAL {
2112 this->list().push_back(ptr);
2113 }
2114 
2117 template <typename T, typename T2>
2118 inline T_Ptr* get(const T& arg1, const T2 arg2) {
2119  iterator iter = std::find_if(this->list().begin(), this->list().end(), Pred(arg1, arg2));
2120  if (iter != this->list().end() && *iter != nullptr) {
2121  return *iter;
2122  }
2123  return nullptr;
2124 }
2125 
2126 private:
2127 virtual inline void deepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>>& sr) {
2128  for (const_iterator it = sr.list().begin(); it != sr.list().end(); ++it) {
2129  registerNew(new T_Ptr(**it));
2130  }
2131 }
2132 };
2133 
2134 } // namespace utils
2135 } // namespace base
2139 class Loggable {
2140 public:
2141  virtual ~Loggable(void) {}
2142  virtual void log(el::base::type::ostream_t&) const = 0;
2143 private:
2144  friend inline el::base::type::ostream_t& operator<<(el::base::type::ostream_t& os, const Loggable& loggable) {
2145  loggable.log(os);
2146  return os;
2147  }
2148 };
2149 namespace base {
2151  class LogFormat : public Loggable {
2152  public:
2153  LogFormat(void) :
2154  m_level(Level::Unknown),
2155  m_userFormat(base::type::string_t()),
2156  m_format(base::type::string_t()),
2157  m_dateTimeFormat(std::string()),
2158  m_flags(0x0) {
2159  }
2160 
2161  LogFormat(Level level, const base::type::string_t& format)
2162  : m_level(level), m_userFormat(format) {
2163  parseFromFormat(m_userFormat);
2164  }
2165 
2166  LogFormat(const LogFormat& logFormat) {
2167  m_level = logFormat.m_level;
2168  m_userFormat = logFormat.m_userFormat;
2169  m_format = logFormat.m_format;
2170  m_dateTimeFormat = logFormat.m_dateTimeFormat;
2171  m_flags = logFormat.m_flags;
2172  }
2173 
2174  LogFormat(LogFormat&& logFormat) {
2175  m_level = std::move(logFormat.m_level);
2176  m_userFormat = std::move(logFormat.m_userFormat);
2177  m_format = std::move(logFormat.m_format);
2178  m_dateTimeFormat = std::move(logFormat.m_dateTimeFormat);
2179  m_flags = std::move(logFormat.m_flags);
2180  }
2181 
2182  LogFormat& operator=(const LogFormat& logFormat) {
2183  m_level = logFormat.m_level;
2184  m_userFormat = logFormat.m_userFormat;
2185  m_dateTimeFormat = logFormat.m_dateTimeFormat;
2186  m_flags = logFormat.m_flags;
2187  return *this;
2188  }
2189 
2190  virtual ~LogFormat(void) {
2191  }
2192 
2193  inline bool operator==(const LogFormat& other) {
2194  return m_level == other.m_level && m_userFormat == other.m_userFormat && m_format == other.m_format &&
2195  m_dateTimeFormat == other.m_dateTimeFormat && m_flags == other.m_flags;
2196  }
2197 
2200  void parseFromFormat(const base::type::string_t& userFormat) {
2201  // We make copy because we will be changing the format
2202  // i.e, removing user provided date format from original format
2203  // and then storing it.
2204  base::type::string_t formatCopy = userFormat;
2205  m_flags = 0x0;
2206  auto conditionalAddFlag = [&](const base::type::char_t* specifier, base::FormatFlags flag) {
2207  std::size_t foundAt = base::type::string_t::npos;
2208  while ((foundAt = formatCopy.find(specifier, foundAt + 1)) != base::type::string_t::npos){
2209  if (foundAt > 0 && formatCopy[foundAt - 1] == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
2210  if (hasFlag(flag)) {
2211  // If we already have flag we remove the escape chars so that '%%' is turned to '%'
2212  // even after specifier resolution - this is because we only replaceFirst specifier
2213  formatCopy.erase(foundAt > 0 ? foundAt - 1 : 0, 1);
2214  ++foundAt;
2215  }
2216  } else {
2217  if (!hasFlag(flag)) addFlag(flag);
2218  }
2219  }
2220  };
2221  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kAppNameFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::AppName);
2222  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::Level);
2223  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::LevelShort);
2224  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kLoggerIdFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::LoggerId);
2225  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kThreadIdFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::ThreadId);
2226  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kLogFileFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::File);
2227  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kLogFileBaseFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::FileBase);
2228  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kLogLineFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::Line);
2229  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kLogLocationFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::Location);
2230  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kLogFunctionFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::Function);
2231  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kCurrentUserFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::User);
2232  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kCurrentHostFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::Host);
2233  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kMessageFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::LogMessage);
2234  conditionalAddFlag(base::consts::kVerboseLevelFormatSpecifier, base::FormatFlags::VerboseLevel);
2235  // For date/time we need to extract user's date format first
2236  std::size_t dateIndex = std::string::npos;
2237  if ((dateIndex = formatCopy.find(base::consts::kDateTimeFormatSpecifier)) != std::string::npos) {
2238  while (dateIndex > 0 && formatCopy[dateIndex - 1] == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
2239  dateIndex = formatCopy.find(base::consts::kDateTimeFormatSpecifier, dateIndex + 1);
2240  }
2241  if (dateIndex != std::string::npos) {
2242  addFlag(base::FormatFlags::DateTime);
2243  updateDateFormat(dateIndex, formatCopy);
2244  }
2245  }
2246  m_format = formatCopy;
2247  updateFormatSpec();
2248  }
2249 
2250  inline Level level(void) const {
2251  return m_level;
2252  }
2253 
2254  inline const base::type::string_t& userFormat(void) const {
2255  return m_userFormat;
2256  }
2257 
2258  inline const base::type::string_t& format(void) const {
2259  return m_format;
2260  }
2261 
2262  inline const std::string& dateTimeFormat(void) const {
2263  return m_dateTimeFormat;
2264  }
2265 
2266  inline base::type::EnumType flags(void) const {
2267  return m_flags;
2268  }
2269 
2270  inline bool hasFlag(base::FormatFlags flag) const {
2271  return base::utils::hasFlag(flag, m_flags);
2272  }
2273 
2274  virtual void log(el::base::type::ostream_t& os) const {
2275  os << m_format;
2276  }
2277 
2278  protected:
2282  virtual void updateDateFormat(std::size_t index, base::type::string_t& currFormat) ELPP_FINAL {
2283  if (hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::DateTime)) {
2284  index += ELPP_STRLEN(base::consts::kDateTimeFormatSpecifier);
2285  }
2286  const base::type::char_t* ptr = currFormat.c_str() + index;
2287  if ((currFormat.size() > index) && (ptr[0] == '{')) {
2288  // User has provided format for date/time
2289  ++ptr;
2290  int count = 1; // Start by 1 in order to remove starting brace
2291  std::stringstream ss;
2292  for (; *ptr; ++ptr, ++count) {
2293  if (*ptr == '}') {
2294  ++count; // In order to remove ending brace
2295  break;
2296  }
2297  ss << *ptr;
2298  }
2299  currFormat.erase(index, count);
2300  m_dateTimeFormat = ss.str();
2301  } else {
2302  // No format provided, use default
2303  if (hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::DateTime)) {
2304  m_dateTimeFormat = std::string(base::consts::kDefaultDateTimeFormat);
2305  }
2306  }
2307  }
2308 
2310  virtual void updateFormatSpec(void) ELPP_FINAL {
2311  // Do not use switch over strongly typed enums because Intel C++ compilers dont support them yet.
2312  if (m_level == Level::Debug) {
2313  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier,
2314  base::consts::kDebugLevelLogValue);
2315  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier,
2316  base::consts::kDebugLevelShortLogValue);
2317  } else if (m_level == Level::Info) {
2318  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier,
2319  base::consts::kInfoLevelLogValue);
2320  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier,
2321  base::consts::kInfoLevelShortLogValue);
2322  } else if (m_level == Level::Warning) {
2323  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier,
2324  base::consts::kWarningLevelLogValue);
2325  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier,
2326  base::consts::kWarningLevelShortLogValue);
2327  } else if (m_level == Level::Error) {
2328  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier,
2329  base::consts::kErrorLevelLogValue);
2330  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier,
2331  base::consts::kErrorLevelShortLogValue);
2332  } else if (m_level == Level::Fatal) {
2333  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier,
2334  base::consts::kFatalLevelLogValue);
2335  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier,
2336  base::consts::kFatalLevelShortLogValue);
2337  } else if (m_level == Level::Verbose) {
2338  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier,
2339  base::consts::kVerboseLevelLogValue);
2340  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier,
2341  base::consts::kVerboseLevelShortLogValue);
2342  } else if (m_level == Level::Trace) {
2343  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelFormatSpecifier,
2344  base::consts::kTraceLevelLogValue);
2345  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kSeverityLevelShortFormatSpecifier,
2346  base::consts::kTraceLevelShortLogValue);
2347  }
2348  if (hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::User)) {
2349  std::string s = base::utils::s_currentUser;
2350  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kCurrentUserFormatSpecifier,
2351  base::utils::s_currentUser);
2352  }
2353  if (hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::Host)) {
2354  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(m_format, base::consts::kCurrentHostFormatSpecifier,
2355  base::utils::s_currentHost);
2356  }
2357  // Ignore Level::Global and Level::Unknown
2358  }
2359 
2360  inline void addFlag(base::FormatFlags flag) {
2361  base::utils::addFlag(flag, &m_flags);
2362  }
2363 
2364  private:
2365  Level m_level;
2366  base::type::string_t m_userFormat;
2367  base::type::string_t m_format;
2368  std::string m_dateTimeFormat;
2369  base::type::EnumType m_flags;
2370  friend class el::Logger; // To resolve loggerId format specifier easily
2371  };
2372 } // namespace base
2374 typedef std::function<const char*(void)> FormatSpecifierValueResolver;
2378 class CustomFormatSpecifier {
2379 public:
2380  CustomFormatSpecifier(const char* formatSpecifier, const FormatSpecifierValueResolver& resolver) :
2381  m_formatSpecifier(formatSpecifier), m_resolver(resolver) {}
2382  inline const char* formatSpecifier(void) const { return m_formatSpecifier; }
2383  inline const FormatSpecifierValueResolver& resolver(void) const { return m_resolver; }
2384  inline bool operator==(const char* formatSpecifier) {
2385  return strcmp(m_formatSpecifier, formatSpecifier) == 0;
2386  }
2387 
2388 private:
2389  const char* m_formatSpecifier;
2390  FormatSpecifierValueResolver m_resolver;
2391 };
2401 class Configuration : public Loggable {
2402 public:
2403  Configuration(const Configuration& c) :
2404  m_level(c.m_level),
2405  m_configurationType(c.m_configurationType),
2406  m_value(c.m_value) {
2407  }
2408 
2409  Configuration& operator=(const Configuration& c) {
2410  m_level = c.m_level;
2411  m_configurationType = c.m_configurationType;
2412  m_value = c.m_value;
2413  return *this;
2414  }
2415 
2416  virtual ~Configuration(void) {
2417  }
2418 
2420  Configuration(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) :
2421  m_level(level),
2422  m_configurationType(configurationType),
2423  m_value(value) {
2424  }
2425 
2427  inline Level level(void) const {
2428  return m_level;
2429  }
2430 
2432  inline ConfigurationType configurationType(void) const {
2433  return m_configurationType;
2434  }
2435 
2437  inline const std::string& value(void) const {
2438  return m_value;
2439  }
2440 
2444  inline void setValue(const std::string& value) {
2445  m_value = value;
2446  }
2447 
2448  virtual inline void log(el::base::type::ostream_t& os) const {
2449  os << LevelHelper::convertToString(m_level)
2450  << ELPP_LITERAL(" ") << ConfigurationTypeHelper::convertToString(m_configurationType)
2451  << ELPP_LITERAL(" = ") << m_value.c_str();
2452  }
2453 
2455  class Predicate {
2456  public:
2457  Predicate(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType) :
2458  m_level(level),
2459  m_configurationType(configurationType) {
2460  }
2461 
2462  inline bool operator()(const Configuration* conf) const {
2463  return ((conf != nullptr) && (conf->level() == m_level) && (conf->configurationType() == m_configurationType));
2464  }
2465 
2466  private:
2467  Level m_level;
2468  ConfigurationType m_configurationType;
2469  };
2470 
2471 private:
2472  Level m_level;
2473  ConfigurationType m_configurationType;
2474  std::string m_value;
2475 };
2476 
2480 class Configurations : public base::utils::RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate> {
2481 public:
2483  Configurations(void) :
2484  m_configurationFile(std::string()),
2485  m_isFromFile(false) {
2486  }
2487 
2494  Configurations(const std::string& configurationFile, bool useDefaultsForRemaining = true, Configurations* base = nullptr) :
2495  m_configurationFile(configurationFile),
2496  m_isFromFile(false) {
2497  parseFromFile(configurationFile, base);
2498  if (useDefaultsForRemaining) {
2499  setRemainingToDefault();
2500  }
2501  }
2502 
2503  virtual ~Configurations(void) {
2504  }
2505 
2512  inline bool parseFromFile(const std::string& configurationFile, Configurations* base = nullptr) {
2513  // We initial assertion with true because if we have assertion diabled, we want to pass this
2514  // check and if assertion is enabled we will have values re-assigned any way.
2515  bool assertionPassed = true;
2516  ELPP_ASSERT((assertionPassed = base::utils::File::pathExists(configurationFile.c_str(), true)),
2517  "Configuration file [" << configurationFile << "] does not exist!");
2518  if (!assertionPassed) {
2519  return false;
2520  }
2521  bool success = Parser::parseFromFile(configurationFile, this, base);
2522  m_isFromFile = success;
2523  return success;
2524  }
2525
