2534  inline bool parseFromText(const std::string& configurationsString, Configurations* base = nullptr) {
2535  bool success = Parser::parseFromText(configurationsString, this, base);
2536  if (success) {
2537  m_isFromFile = false;
2538  }
2539  return success;
2540  }
2541 
2544  inline void setFromBase(Configurations* base) {
2545  if (base == nullptr || base == this) {
2546  return;
2547  }
2548  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(base->lock());
2549  for (Configuration*& conf : base->list()) {
2550  set(conf);
2551  }
2552  }
2553 
2558  bool hasConfiguration(ConfigurationType configurationType) {
2559  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
2560  bool result = false;
2561  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
2562  if (hasConfiguration(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), configurationType)) {
2563  result = true;
2564  }
2565  return result;
2566  });
2567  return result;
2568  }
2569 
2573  inline bool hasConfiguration(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType) {
2574  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2575 #if ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL
2576  // We cant specify template types here, Intel C++ throws compilation error
2577  // "error: type name is not allowed"
2578  return RegistryWithPred::get(level, configurationType) != nullptr;
2579 #else
2580  return RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate>::get(level, configurationType) != nullptr;
2581 #endif // ELPP_COMPILER_INTEL
2582  }
2583 
2596  inline void set(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) {
2597  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2598  unsafeSet(level, configurationType, value); // This is not unsafe anymore as we have locked mutex
2599  if (level == Level::Global) {
2600  unsafeSetGlobally(configurationType, value, false); // Again this is not unsafe either
2601  }
2602  }
2603 
2606  inline void set(Configuration* conf) {
2607  if (conf == nullptr) {
2608  return;
2609  }
2610  set(conf->level(), conf->configurationType(), conf->value());
2611  }
2612 
2613  inline Configuration* get(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType) {
2614  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2615  return RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate>::get(level, configurationType);
2616  }
2617 
2622  inline void setGlobally(ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) {
2623  setGlobally(configurationType, value, false);
2624  }
2625 
2627  inline void clear(void) {
2628  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2629  unregisterAll();
2630  }
2631 
2635  inline const std::string& configurationFile(void) const {
2636  return m_configurationFile;
2637  }
2638 
2640  void setToDefault(void) {
2641  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Enabled, std::string("true"), true);
2642 #if !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2643  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Filename, std::string(base::consts::kDefaultLogFile), true);
2644 #else
2645  ELPP_UNUSED(base::consts::kDefaultLogFile);
2646 #endif // !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2647  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::ToFile, std::string("true"), true);
2648  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput, std::string("true"), true);
2649  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth, std::string("3"), true);
2650  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking, std::string("true"), true);
2651  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize, std::string("0"), true);
2652  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::LogFlushThreshold, std::string("0"), true);
2653 
2654  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"), true);
2655  set(Level::Debug, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%user@%host] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2656  // INFO and WARNING are set to default by Level::Global
2657  set(Level::Error, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2658  set(Level::Fatal, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2659  set(Level::Verbose, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level-%vlevel [%logger] %msg"));
2660  set(Level::Trace, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2661  }
2662 
2670  void setRemainingToDefault(void) {
2671  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2672  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Enabled, std::string("true"));
2673 #if !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2674  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Filename, std::string(base::consts::kDefaultLogFile));
2675 #endif // !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2676  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::ToFile, std::string("true"));
2677  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput, std::string("true"));
2678  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth, std::string("3"));
2679  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking, std::string("true"));
2680  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize, std::string("0"));
2681  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2682  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Debug, ConfigurationType::Format,
2683  std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%user@%host] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2684  // INFO and WARNING are set to default by Level::Global
2685  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Error, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2686  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Fatal, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2687  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Verbose, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level-%vlevel [%logger] %msg"));
2688  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Trace, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2689  }
2690 
2695  class Parser : base::StaticClass {
2696  public:
2704  static bool parseFromFile(const std::string& configurationFile, Configurations* sender, Configurations* base = nullptr) {
2705  sender->setFromBase(base);
2706  std::ifstream fileStream_(configurationFile.c_str(), std::ifstream::in);
2707  ELPP_ASSERT(fileStream_.is_open(), "Unable to open configuration file [" << configurationFile << "] for parsing.");
2708  bool parsedSuccessfully = false;
2709  std::string line = std::string();
2710  Level currLevel = Level::Unknown;
2711  std::string currConfigStr = std::string();
2712  std::string currLevelStr = std::string();
2713  while (fileStream_.good()) {
2714  std::getline(fileStream_, line);
2715  parsedSuccessfully = parseLine(&line, &currConfigStr, &currLevelStr, &currLevel, sender);
2716  ELPP_ASSERT(parsedSuccessfully, "Unable to parse configuration line: " << line);
2717  }
2718  return parsedSuccessfully;
2719  }
2720 
2731  static bool parseFromText(const std::string& configurationsString, Configurations* sender, Configurations* base = nullptr) {
2732  sender->setFromBase(base);
2733  bool parsedSuccessfully = false;
2734  std::stringstream ss(configurationsString);
2735  std::string line = std::string();
2736  Level currLevel = Level::Unknown;
2737  std::string currConfigStr = std::string();
2738  std::string currLevelStr = std::string();
2739  while (std::getline(ss, line)) {
2740  parsedSuccessfully = parseLine(&line, &currConfigStr, &currLevelStr, &currLevel, sender);
2741  ELPP_ASSERT(parsedSuccessfully, "Unable to parse configuration line: " << line);
2742  }
2743  return parsedSuccessfully;
2744  }
2745 
2746  private:
2747  friend class el::Loggers;
2748  static void ignoreComments(std::string* line) {
2749  std::size_t foundAt = 0;
2750  std::size_t quotesStart = line->find("\"");
2751  std::size_t quotesEnd = std::string::npos;
2752  if (quotesStart != std::string::npos) {
2753  quotesEnd = line->find("\"", quotesStart + 1);
2754  while (quotesEnd != std::string::npos && line->at(quotesEnd - 1) == '\\') {
2755  // Do not erase slash yet - we will erase it in parseLine(..) while loop
2756  quotesEnd = line->find("\"", quotesEnd + 2);
2757  }
2758  }
2759  if ((foundAt = line->find(base::consts::kConfigurationComment)) != std::string::npos) {
2760  if (foundAt < quotesEnd) {
2761  foundAt = line->find(base::consts::kConfigurationComment, quotesEnd + 1);
2762  }
2763  *line = line->substr(0, foundAt);
2764  }
2765  }
2766  static inline bool isLevel(const std::string& line) {
2767  return base::utils::Str::startsWith(line, std::string(base::consts::kConfigurationLevel));
2768  }
2769 
2770  static inline bool isComment(const std::string& line) {
2771  return base::utils::Str::startsWith(line, std::string(base::consts::kConfigurationComment));
2772  }
2773 
2774  static inline bool isConfig(const std::string& line) {
2775  std::size_t assignment = line.find('=');
2776  return line != "" &&
2777  ((line[0] >= 65 && line[0] <= 90) || (line[0] >= 97 && line[0] <= 122)) &&
2778  (assignment != std::string::npos) &&
2779  (line.size() > assignment);
2780  }
2781 
2782  static bool parseLine(std::string* line, std::string* currConfigStr, std::string* currLevelStr, Level* currLevel, Configurations* conf) {
2783  ConfigurationType currConfig = ConfigurationType::Unknown;
2784  std::string currValue = std::string();
2785  *line = base::utils::Str::trim(*line);
2786  if (isComment(*line)) return true;
2787  ignoreComments(line);
2788  *line = base::utils::Str::trim(*line);
2789  if (line->empty()) {
2790  // Comment ignored
2791  return true;
2792  }
2793  if (isLevel(*line)) {
2794  if (line->size() <= 2) {
2795  return true;
2796  }
2797  *currLevelStr = line->substr(1, line->size() - 2);
2798  *currLevelStr = base::utils::Str::toUpper(*currLevelStr);
2799  *currLevelStr = base::utils::Str::trim(*currLevelStr);
2800  *currLevel = LevelHelper::convertFromString(currLevelStr->c_str());
2801  return true;
2802  }
2803  if (isConfig(*line)) {
2804  std::size_t assignment = line->find('=');
2805  *currConfigStr = line->substr(0, assignment);
2806  *currConfigStr = base::utils::Str::toUpper(*currConfigStr);
2807  *currConfigStr = base::utils::Str::trim(*currConfigStr);
2808  currConfig = ConfigurationTypeHelper::convertFromString(currConfigStr->c_str());
2809  currValue = line->substr(assignment + 1);
2810  currValue = base::utils::Str::trim(currValue);
2811  std::size_t quotesStart = currValue.find("\"", 0);
2812  std::size_t quotesEnd = std::string::npos;
2813  if (quotesStart != std::string::npos) {
2814  quotesEnd = currValue.find("\"", quotesStart + 1);
2815  while (quotesEnd != std::string::npos && currValue.at(quotesEnd - 1) == '\\') {
2816  currValue = currValue.erase(quotesEnd - 1, 1);
2817  quotesEnd = currValue.find("\"", quotesEnd + 2);
2818  }
2819  }
2820  if (quotesStart != std::string::npos && quotesEnd != std::string::npos) {
2821  // Quote provided - check and strip if valid
2822  ELPP_ASSERT((quotesStart < quotesEnd), "Configuration error - No ending quote found in ["
2823  << currConfigStr << "]");
2824  ELPP_ASSERT((quotesStart + 1 != quotesEnd), "Empty configuration value for [" << currConfigStr << "]");
2825  if ((quotesStart != quotesEnd) && (quotesStart + 1 != quotesEnd)) {
2826  // Explicit check in case if assertion is disabled
2827  currValue = currValue.substr(quotesStart + 1, quotesEnd - 1);
2828  }
2829  }
2830  }
2831  ELPP_ASSERT(*currLevel != Level::Unknown, "Unrecognized severity level [" << *currLevelStr << "]");
2832  ELPP_ASSERT(currConfig != ConfigurationType::Unknown, "Unrecognized configuration [" << *currConfigStr << "]");
2833  if (*currLevel == Level::Unknown || currConfig == ConfigurationType::Unknown) {
2834  return false; // unrecognizable level or config
2835  }
2836  conf->set(*currLevel, currConfig, currValue);
2837  return true;
2838  }
2839  };
2840 
2841 private:
2842  std::string m_configurationFile;
2843  bool m_isFromFile;
2844  friend class el::Loggers;
2845 
2847  void unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) {
2848  Configuration* conf = RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate>::get(level, configurationType);
2849  if (conf == nullptr) {
2850  unsafeSet(level, configurationType, value);
2851  }
2852  }
2853 
2855  void unsafeSet(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) {
2856  Configuration* conf = RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate>::get(level, configurationType);
2857  if (conf == nullptr) {
2858  registerNew(new Configuration(level, configurationType, value));
2859  } else {
2860  conf->setValue(value);
2861  }
2862  if (level == Level::Global) {
2863  unsafeSetGlobally(configurationType, value, false);
2864  }
2865  }
2866 
2869  void setGlobally(ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value, bool includeGlobalLevel) {
2870  if (includeGlobalLevel) {
2871  set(Level::Global, configurationType, value);
2872  }
2873  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
2874  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
2875  set(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), configurationType, value);
2876  return false; // Do not break lambda function yet as we need to set all levels regardless
2877  });
2878  }
2879 
2882  void unsafeSetGlobally(ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value, bool includeGlobalLevel) {
2883  if (includeGlobalLevel) {
2884  unsafeSet(Level::Global, configurationType, value);
2885  }
2886  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
2887  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
2888  unsafeSet(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), configurationType, value);
2889  return false; // Do not break lambda function yet as we need to set all levels regardless
2890  });
2891  }
2892 };
2893 
2894 namespace base {
2895  typedef std::shared_ptr<base::type::fstream_t> FileStreamPtr;
2896  typedef std::map<std::string, FileStreamPtr> LogStreamsReferenceMap;
2903  class TypedConfigurations : public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
2904  public:
2908  TypedConfigurations(Configurations* configurations, base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference) {
2909  m_configurations = configurations;
2910  m_logStreamsReference = logStreamsReference;
2911  build(m_configurations);
2912  }
2913 
2914  TypedConfigurations(const TypedConfigurations& other) {
2915  this->m_configurations = other.m_configurations;
2916  this->m_logStreamsReference = other.m_logStreamsReference;
2917  build(m_configurations);
2918  }
2919 
2920  virtual ~TypedConfigurations(void) {
2921  }
2922 
2923  const Configurations* configurations(void) const {
2924  return m_configurations;
2925  }
2926 
2927  inline bool enabled(Level level) {
2928  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_enabledMap, "enabled");
2929  }
2930 
2931  inline bool toFile(Level level) {
2932  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_toFileMap, "toFile");
2933  }
2934 
2935  inline const std::string& filename(Level level) {
2936  return getConfigByRef<std::string>(level, &m_filenameMap, "filename");
2937  }
2938 
2939  inline bool toStandardOutput(Level level) {
2940  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_toStandardOutputMap, "toStandardOutput");
2941  }
2942 
2943  inline const base::LogFormat& logFormat(Level level) {
2944  return getConfigByRef<base::LogFormat>(level, &m_logFormatMap, "logFormat");
2945  }
2946 
2947  inline const base::MillisecondsWidth& millisecondsWidth(Level level = Level::Global) {
2948  return getConfigByRef<base::MillisecondsWidth>(level, &m_millisecondsWidthMap, "millisecondsWidth");
2949  }
2950 
2951  inline bool performanceTracking(Level level = Level::Global) {
2952  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_performanceTrackingMap, "performanceTracking");
2953  }
2954 
2955  inline base::type::fstream_t* fileStream(Level level) {
2956  return getConfigByRef<base::FileStreamPtr>(level, &m_fileStreamMap, "fileStream").get();
2957  }
2958 
2959  inline std::size_t maxLogFileSize(Level level) {
2960  return getConfigByVal<std::size_t>(level, &m_maxLogFileSizeMap, "maxLogFileSize");
2961  }
2962 
2963  inline std::size_t logFlushThreshold(Level level) {
2964  return getConfigByVal<std::size_t>(level, &m_logFlushThresholdMap, "logFlushThreshold");
2965  }
2966 
2967  private:
2968  Configurations* m_configurations;
2969  std::map<Level, bool> m_enabledMap;
2970  std::map<Level, bool> m_toFileMap;
2971  std::map<Level, std::string> m_filenameMap;
2972  std::map<Level, bool> m_toStandardOutputMap;
2973  std::map<Level, base::LogFormat> m_logFormatMap;
2974  std::map<Level, base::MillisecondsWidth> m_millisecondsWidthMap;
2975  std::map<Level, bool> m_performanceTrackingMap;
2976  std::map<Level, base::FileStreamPtr> m_fileStreamMap;
2977  std::map<Level, std::size_t> m_maxLogFileSizeMap;
2978  std::map<Level, std::size_t> m_logFlushThresholdMap;
2979  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* m_logStreamsReference;
2980 
2981  friend class el::Helpers;
2982  friend class el::base::MessageBuilder;
2983  friend class el::base::Writer;
2984  friend class el::base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
2985  friend class el::base::LogDispatcher;
2986 
2987  template <typename Conf_T>
2988  inline Conf_T getConfigByVal(Level level, const std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
2989  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2990  return unsafeGetConfigByVal(level, confMap, confName); // This is not unsafe anymore - mutex locked in scope
2991  }
2992 
2993  template <typename Conf_T>
2994  inline Conf_T& getConfigByRef(Level level, std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
2995  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2996  return unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, confMap, confName); // This is not unsafe anymore - mutex locked in scope
2997  }
2998 
2999  template <typename Conf_T>
3000  inline Conf_T unsafeGetConfigByVal(Level level, const std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
3001  ELPP_UNUSED(confName);
3002  typename std::map<Level, Conf_T>::const_iterator it = confMap->find(level);
3003  if (it == confMap->end()) {
3004  try {
3005  return confMap->at(Level::Global);
3006  } catch (...) {
3007  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to get configuration [" << confName << "] for level ["
3008  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]"
3009  << std::endl << "Please ensure you have properly configured logger.", false);
3010  return Conf_T();
3011  }
3012  }
3013  return it->second;
3014  }
3015 
3016  template <typename Conf_T>
3017  inline Conf_T& unsafeGetConfigByRef(Level level, std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
3018  ELPP_UNUSED(confName);
3019  typename std::map<Level, Conf_T>::iterator it = confMap->find(level);
3020  if (it == confMap->end()) {
3021  try {
3022  return confMap->at(Level::Global);
3023  } catch (...) {
3024  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to get configuration [" << confName << "] for level ["
3025  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]"
3026  << std::endl << "Please ensure you have properly configured logger.", false);
3027  }
3028  }
3029  return it->second;
3030  }
3031 
3032  template <typename Conf_T>
3033  void setValue(Level level, const Conf_T& value, std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, bool includeGlobalLevel = true) {
3034  // If map is empty and we are allowed to add into generic level (Level::Global), do it!
3035  if (confMap->empty() && includeGlobalLevel) {
3036  confMap->insert(std::make_pair(Level::Global, value));
3037  return;
3038  }
3039  // If same value exist in generic level already, dont add it to explicit level
3040  typename std::map<Level, Conf_T>::iterator it = confMap->find(Level::Global);
3041  if (it != confMap->end() && it->second == value) {
3042  return;
3043  }
3044  // Now make sure we dont double up values if we really need to add it to explicit level
3045  it = confMap->find(level);
3046  if (it == confMap->end()) {
3047  // Value not found for level, add new
3048  confMap->insert(std::make_pair(level, value));
3049  } else {
3050  // Value found, just update value
3051  confMap->at(level) = value;
3052  }
3053  }
3054 
3055  void build(Configurations* configurations) {
3056  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3057  auto getBool = [] (std::string boolStr) -> bool { // Pass by value for trimming
3058  base::utils::Str::trim(boolStr);
3059  return (boolStr == "TRUE" || boolStr == "true" || boolStr == "1");
3060  };
3061  std::vector<Configuration*> withFileSizeLimit;
3062  for (Configurations::const_iterator it = configurations->begin(); it != configurations->end(); ++it) {
3063  Configuration* conf = *it;
3064  // We cannot use switch on strong enums because Intel C++ dont support them yet
3065  if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Enabled) {
3066  setValue(conf->level(), getBool(conf->value()), &m_enabledMap);
3067  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::ToFile) {
3068  setValue(conf->level(), getBool(conf->value()), &m_toFileMap);
3069  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput) {
3070  setValue(conf->level(), getBool(conf->value()), &m_toStandardOutputMap);
3071  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Filename) {
3072  // We do not yet configure filename but we will configure in another
3073  // loop. This is because if file cannot be created, we will force ToFile
3074  // to be false. Because configuring logger is not necessarily performance
3075  // sensative operation, we can live with another loop; (by the way this loop
3076  // is not very heavy either)
3077  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Format) {
3078  setValue(conf->level(), base::LogFormat(conf->level(),
3079  base::type::string_t(conf->value().begin(), conf->value().end())), &m_logFormatMap);
3080  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth) {
3081  setValue(Level::Global,
3082  base::MillisecondsWidth(static_cast<int>(getULong(conf->value()))), &m_millisecondsWidthMap);
3083  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking) {
3084  setValue(Level::Global, getBool(conf->value()), &m_performanceTrackingMap);
3085  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize) {
3086  setValue(conf->level(), static_cast<std::size_t>(getULong(conf->value())), &m_maxLogFileSizeMap);
3087 #if !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
3088  withFileSizeLimit.push_back(conf);
3089 #endif // !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
3090  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::LogFlushThreshold) {
3091  setValue(conf->level(), static_cast<std::size_t>(getULong(conf->value())), &m_logFlushThresholdMap);
3092  }
3093  }
3094  // As mentioned early, we will now set filename configuration in separate loop to deal with non-existent files
3095  for (Configurations::const_iterator it = configurations->begin(); it != configurations->end(); ++it) {
3096  Configuration* conf = *it;
3097  if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Filename) {
3098  insertFile(conf->level(), conf->value());
3099  }
3100  }
3101  for (std::vector<Configuration*>::iterator conf = withFileSizeLimit.begin();
3102  conf != withFileSizeLimit.end(); ++conf) {
3103  // This is not unsafe as mutex is locked in currect scope
3104  unsafeValidateFileRolling((*conf)->level(), base::defaultPreRollOutCallback);
3105  }
3106  }
3107 
3108  unsigned long getULong(std::string confVal) {
3109  bool valid = true;
3110  base::utils::Str::trim(confVal);
3111  valid = !confVal.empty() && std::find_if(confVal.begin(), confVal.end(),
3112  [](char c) { return !base::utils::Str::isDigit(c); }) == confVal.end();
3113  if (!valid) {
3114  valid = false;
3115  ELPP_ASSERT(valid, "Configuration value not a valid integer [" << confVal << "]");
3116  return 0;
3117  }
3118  return atol(confVal.c_str());
3119  }
3120 
3121  std::string resolveFilename(const std::string& filename) {
3122  std::string resultingFilename = filename;
3123  std::size_t dateIndex = std::string::npos;
3124  std::string dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr = std::string(base::consts::kDateTimeFormatSpecifierForFilename);
3125  if ((dateIndex = resultingFilename.find(dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.c_str())) != std::string::npos) {
3126  while (dateIndex > 0 && resultingFilename[dateIndex - 1] == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
3127  dateIndex = resultingFilename.find(dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.c_str(), dateIndex + 1);
3128  }
3129  if (dateIndex != std::string::npos) {
3130  const char* ptr = resultingFilename.c_str() + dateIndex;
3131  // Goto end of specifier
3132  ptr += dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.size();
3133  std::string fmt;
3134  if ((resultingFilename.size() > dateIndex) && (ptr[0] == '{')) {
3135  // User has provided format for date/time
3136  ++ptr;
3137  int count = 1; // Start by 1 in order to remove starting brace
3138  std::stringstream ss;
3139  for (; *ptr; ++ptr, ++count) {
3140  if (*ptr == '}') {
3141  ++count; // In order to remove ending brace
3142  break;
3143  }
3144  ss << *ptr;
3145  }
3146  resultingFilename.erase(dateIndex + dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.size(), count);
3147  fmt = ss.str();
3148  } else {
3149  fmt = std::string(base::consts::kDefaultDateTimeFormatInFilename);
3150  }
3151  base::MillisecondsWidth msWidth(3);
3152  std::string now = base::utils::DateTime::getDateTime(fmt.c_str(), &msWidth);
3153  base::utils::Str::replaceAll(now, '/', '-'); // Replace path element since we are dealing with filename
3154  base::utils::Str::replaceAll(resultingFilename, dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr, now);
3155  }
3156  }
3157  return resultingFilename;
3158  }
3159 
3160  void insertFile(Level level, const std::string& fullFilename) {
3161  std::string resolvedFilename = resolveFilename(fullFilename);
3162  if (resolvedFilename.empty()) {
3163  std::cerr << "Could not load empty file for logging, please re-check your configurations for level ["
3164  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]";
3165  }
3166  std::string filePath = base::utils::File::extractPathFromFilename(resolvedFilename, base::consts::kFilePathSeperator);
3167  if (filePath.size() < resolvedFilename.size()) {
3168  base::utils::File::createPath(filePath);
3169  }
3170  auto create = [&](Level level) {
3171  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap::iterator filestreamIter = m_logStreamsReference->find(resolvedFilename);
3172  base::type::fstream_t* fs = nullptr;
3173  if (filestreamIter == m_logStreamsReference->end()) {
3174  // We need a completely new stream, nothing to share with
3175  fs = base::utils::File::newFileStream(resolvedFilename);
3176  m_filenameMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, resolvedFilename));
3177  m_fileStreamMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, base::FileStreamPtr(fs)));
3178  m_logStreamsReference->insert(std::make_pair(resolvedFilename, base::FileStreamPtr(m_fileStreamMap.at(level))));
3179  } else {
3180  // Woops! we have an existing one, share it!
3181  m_filenameMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, filestreamIter->first));
3182  m_fileStreamMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, base::FileStreamPtr(filestreamIter->second)));
3183  fs = filestreamIter->second.get();
3184  }
3185  if (fs == nullptr) {
3186  // We display bad file error from newFileStream()
3187  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Setting [TO_FILE] of ["
3188  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "] to FALSE", false);
3189  setValue(level, false, &m_toFileMap);
3190  }
3191  };
3192  // If we dont have file conf for any level, create it for Level::Global first
3193  // otherwise create for specified level
3194  create(m_filenameMap.empty() && m_fileStreamMap.empty() ? Level::Global : level);
3195  }
3196 
3197  bool unsafeValidateFileRolling(Level level, const PreRollOutCallback& PreRollOutCallback) {
3198  base::type::fstream_t* fs = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_fileStreamMap, "fileStream").get();
3199  if (fs == nullptr) {
3200  return true;
3201  }
3202  std::size_t maxLogFileSize = unsafeGetConfigByVal(level, &m_maxLogFileSizeMap, "maxLogFileSize");
3203  std::size_t currFileSize = base::utils::File::getSizeOfFile(fs);
3204  if (maxLogFileSize != 0 && currFileSize >= maxLogFileSize) {
3205  std::string fname = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_filenameMap, "filename");
3206  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Truncating log file [" << fname << "] as a result of configurations for level ["
3207  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]");
3208  fs->close();
3209  PreRollOutCallback(fname.c_str(), currFileSize);
3210  fs->open(fname, std::fstream::out | std::fstream::trunc);
3211  return true;
3212  }
3213  return false;
3214  }
3215 
3216  bool validateFileRolling(Level level, const PreRollOutCallback& PreRollOutCallback) {
3217  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3218  return unsafeValidateFileRolling(level, PreRollOutCallback);
3219  }
3220  };
3222  class HitCounter {
3223  public:
3224  HitCounter(void) :
3225  m_filename(""),
3226  m_lineNumber(0),
3227  m_hitCounts(0) {
3228  }
3229 
3230  HitCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber) :
3231  m_filename(filename),
3232  m_lineNumber(lineNumber),
3233  m_hitCounts(0) {
3234  }
3235 
3236  HitCounter(const HitCounter& hitCounter) :
3237  m_filename(hitCounter.m_filename),
3238  m_lineNumber(hitCounter.m_lineNumber),
3239  m_hitCounts(hitCounter.m_hitCounts) {
3240  }
3241 
3242  HitCounter& operator=(const HitCounter& hitCounter) {
3243  m_filename = hitCounter.m_filename;
3244  m_lineNumber = hitCounter.m_lineNumber;
3245  m_hitCounts = hitCounter.m_hitCounts;
3246  return *this;
3247  }
3248 
3249  virtual ~HitCounter(void) {
3250  }
3251 
3253  inline void resetLocation(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber) {
3254  m_filename = filename;
3255  m_lineNumber = lineNumber;
3256  }
3257 
3259  inline void validateHitCounts(std::size_t n) {
3260  if (m_hitCounts >= base::consts::kMaxLogPerCounter) {
3261  m_hitCounts = (n >= 1 ? base::consts::kMaxLogPerCounter % n : 0);
3262  }
3263  ++m_hitCounts;
3264  }
3265 
3266  inline const char* filename(void) const {
3267  return m_filename;
3268  }
3269 
3270  inline unsigned long int lineNumber(void) const {
3271  return m_lineNumber;
3272  }
3273 
3274  inline std::size_t hitCounts(void) const {
3275  return m_hitCounts;
3276  }
3277 
3278  inline void increment(void) {
3279  ++m_hitCounts;
3280  }
3281 
3282  class Predicate {
3283  public:
3284  Predicate(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber)
3285  : m_filename(filename),
3286  m_lineNumber(lineNumber) {
3287  }
3288  inline bool operator()(const HitCounter* counter) {
3289  return ((counter != nullptr) &&
3290  (strcmp(counter->m_filename, m_filename) == 0) &&
3291  (counter->m_lineNumber == m_lineNumber));
3292  }
3293 
3294  private:
3295  const char* m_filename;
3296  unsigned long int m_lineNumber;
3297  };
3298 
3299  private:
3300  const char* m_filename;
3301  unsigned long int m_lineNumber;
3302  std::size_t m_hitCounts;
3303  };
3305  class RegisteredHitCounters : public base::utils::RegistryWithPred<base::HitCounter, base::HitCounter::Predicate> {
3306  public:
3309  bool validateEveryN(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) {
3310  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3311  base::HitCounter* counter = get(filename, lineNumber);
3312  if (counter == nullptr) {
3313  registerNew(counter = new base::HitCounter(filename, lineNumber));
3314  }
3315  counter->validateHitCounts(n);
3316  bool result = (n >= 1 && counter->hitCounts() != 0 && counter->hitCounts() % n == 0);
3317  return result;
3318  }
3319 
3322  bool validateAfterN(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) {
3323  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3324  base::HitCounter* counter = get(filename, lineNumber);
3325  if (counter == nullptr) {
3326  registerNew(counter = new base::HitCounter(filename, lineNumber));
3327  }
3328  // Do not use validateHitCounts here since we do not want to reset counter here
3329  // Note the >= instead of > because we are incrementing
3330  // after this check
3331  if (counter->hitCounts() >= n)
3332  return true;
3333  counter->increment();
3334  return false;
3335  }
3336 
3339  bool validateNTimes(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) {
3340  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3341  base::HitCounter* counter = get(filename, lineNumber);
3342  if (counter == nullptr) {
3343  registerNew(counter = new base::HitCounter(filename, lineNumber));
3344  }
3345  counter->increment();
3346  // Do not use validateHitCounts here since we do not want to reset counter here
3347  if (counter->hitCounts() <= n)
3348  return true;
3349  return false;
3350  }
3351 
3353  inline const base::HitCounter* getCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber) {
3354  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3355  return get(filename, lineNumber);
3356  }
3357  };
3359  enum class DispatchAction : base::type::EnumType {
3360  None = 1, NormalLog = 2, SysLog = 4
3361  };
3362  } // namespace base
3363  template <typename T>
3364  class Callback : protected base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3365  public:
3366  Callback(void) : m_enabled(true) {}
3367  inline bool enabled(void) const { return m_enabled; }
3368  inline void setEnabled(bool enabled) {
3369  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3370  m_enabled = enabled;
3371  }
3372  protected:
3373  virtual void handle(const T* handlePtr) = 0;
3374  private:
3375  bool m_enabled;
3376  };
3377  class LogDispatchData {
3378  public:
3379  LogDispatchData() : m_logMessage(nullptr), m_dispatchAction(base::DispatchAction::None) {}
3380  inline const LogMessage* logMessage(void) const { return m_logMessage; }
3381  inline base::DispatchAction dispatchAction(void) const { return m_dispatchAction; }
3382  private:
3383  LogMessage* m_logMessage;
3384  base::DispatchAction m_dispatchAction;
3385  friend class base::LogDispatcher;
3386 
3387  inline void setLogMessage(LogMessage* logMessage) { m_logMessage = logMessage; }
3388  inline void setDispatchAction(base::DispatchAction dispatchAction) { m_dispatchAction = dispatchAction; }
3389  };
3390  class LogDispatchCallback : public Callback<LogDispatchData> {
3391  private:
3392  friend class base::LogDispatcher;
3393  };
3394  class PerformanceTrackingCallback : public Callback<PerformanceTrackingData> {
3395  private:
3396  friend class base::PerformanceTracker;
3397  };
3398  class LogBuilder : base::NoCopy {
3399  public:
3400  virtual ~LogBuilder(void) { ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(3, "Destroying log builder...")}
3401  virtual base::type::string_t build(const LogMessage* logMessage, bool appendNewLine) const = 0;
3402  void convertToColoredOutput(base::type::string_t* logLine, Level level) {
3403  if (!base::utils::s_termSupportsColor) return;
3404  const base::type::char_t* resetColor = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[0m");
3405  if (level == Level::Error || level == Level::Fatal)
3406  *logLine = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[31m") + *logLine + resetColor;
3407  else if (level == Level::Warning)
3408  *logLine = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[33m") + *logLine + resetColor;
3409  else if (level == Level::Debug)
3410  *logLine = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[32m") + *logLine + resetColor;
3411  else if (level == Level::Info)
3412  *logLine = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[36m") + *logLine + resetColor;
3413  else if (level == Level::Trace)
3414  *logLine = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[35m") + *logLine + resetColor;
3415  }
3416  private:
3417  friend class el::base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
3418  };
3419  typedef std::shared_ptr<LogBuilder> LogBuilderPtr;
3423  class Logger : public base::threading::ThreadSafe, public Loggable {
3424  public:
3425  Logger(const std::string& id, base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference) :
3426  m_id(id),
3427  m_typedConfigurations(nullptr),
3428  m_parentApplicationName(std::string()),
3429  m_isConfigured(false),
3430  m_logStreamsReference(logStreamsReference) {
3431  initUnflushedCount();
3432  }
3433 
3434  Logger(const std::string& id, const Configurations& configurations, base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference) :
3435  m_id(id),
3436  m_typedConfigurations(nullptr),
3437  m_parentApplicationName(std::string()),
3438  m_isConfigured(false),
3439  m_logStreamsReference(logStreamsReference) {
3440  initUnflushedCount();
3441  configure(configurations);
3442  }
3443 
3444  Logger(const Logger& logger) {
3445  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3446  m_id = logger.m_id;
3447  m_typedConfigurations = logger.m_typedConfigurations;
3448  m_parentApplicationName = logger.m_parentApplicationName;
3449  m_isConfigured = logger.m_isConfigured;
3450  m_configurations = logger.m_configurations;
3451  m_unflushedCount = logger.m_unflushedCount;
3452  m_logStreamsReference = logger.m_logStreamsReference;
3453  }
3454 
3455  Logger& operator=(const Logger& logger) {
3456  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3457  m_id = logger.m_id;
3458  m_typedConfigurations = logger.m_typedConfigurations;
3459  m_parentApplicationName = logger.m_parentApplicationName;
3460  m_isConfigured = logger.m_isConfigured;
3461  m_configurations = logger.m_configurations;
3462  m_unflushedCount = logger.m_unflushedCount;
3463  m_logStreamsReference = logger.m_logStreamsReference;
3464  return *this;
3465  }
3466 
3467  virtual ~Logger(void) {
3468  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3469  }
3470 
3471  virtual inline void log(el::base::type::ostream_t& os) const {
3472  os << m_id.c_str();
3473  }
3474 
3476  void configure(const Configurations& configurations) {
3477  m_isConfigured = false; // we set it to false in case if we fail
3478  initUnflushedCount();
3479  if (m_typedConfigurations != nullptr) {
3480  Configurations* c = const_cast<Configurations*>(m_typedConfigurations->configurations());
3481  if (c->hasConfiguration(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Filename)) {
3482  // This check is definitely needed for cases like ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE
3483  flush();
3484  }
3485  }
3486  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3487  if (m_configurations != configurations) {
3488  m_configurations.setFromBase(const_cast<Configurations*>(&configurations));
3489  }
3490  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3491  m_typedConfigurations = new base::TypedConfigurations(&m_configurations, m_logStreamsReference);
3492  resolveLoggerFormatSpec();
3493  m_isConfigured = true;
3494  }
3495 
3497  inline void reconfigure(void) {
3498  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Reconfiguring logger [" << m_id << "]");
3499  configure(m_configurations);
3500  }
3501 
3502  inline const std::string& id(void) const {
3503  return m_id;
3504  }
3505 
3506  inline const std::string& parentApplicationName(void) const {
3507  return m_parentApplicationName;
3508  }
3509 
3510  inline void setParentApplicationName(const std::string& parentApplicationName) {
3511  m_parentApplicationName = parentApplicationName;
3512  }
3513 
3514  inline Configurations* configurations(void) {
3515  return &m_configurations;
3516  }
3517 
3518  inline base::TypedConfigurations* typedConfigurations(void) {
3519  return m_typedConfigurations;
3520  }
3521 
3522  static inline bool isValidId(const std::string& id) {
3523  for (std::string::const_iterator it = id.begin(); it != id.end(); ++it) {
3524  if (!base::utils::Str::contains(base::consts::kValidLoggerIdSymbols, *it)) {
3525  return false;
3526  }
3527  }
3528  return true;
3529  }
3531  inline void flush(void) {
3532  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(3, "Flushing logger [" << m_id << "] all levels");
3533  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3534  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
3535  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
3536  flush(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), nullptr);
3537  return false;
3538  });
3539  }
3540 
3541  inline void flush(Level level, base::type::fstream_t* fs) {
3542  if (fs == nullptr && m_typedConfigurations->toFile(level)) {
3543  fs = m_typedConfigurations->fileStream(level);
3544  }
3545  if (fs != nullptr) {
3546  fs->flush();
3547  m_unflushedCount.find(level)->second = 0;
3548  }
3549  }
3550 
3551  inline bool isFlushNeeded(Level level) {
3552  return ++m_unflushedCount.find(level)->second >= m_typedConfigurations->logFlushThreshold(level);
3553  }
3554 
3555  inline LogBuilder* logBuilder(void) const {
3556  return m_logBuilder.get();
3557  }
3558 
3559  inline void setLogBuilder(const LogBuilderPtr& logBuilder) {
3560  m_logBuilder = logBuilder;
3561  }
3562 
3563  inline bool enabled(Level level) const {
3564  return m_typedConfigurations->enabled(level);
3565  }
3566 
3567 #if ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3568 # define LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(FUNCTION_NAME)\
3569 template <typename T, typename... Args>\
3570 inline void FUNCTION_NAME(const char*, const T&, const Args&...);\
3571 template <typename T>\
3572 inline void FUNCTION_NAME(const T&);
3573 
3574  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3575  inline void verbose(int, const char*, const T&, const Args&...);
3576 
3577  template <typename T>
3578  inline void verbose(int, const T&);
3579 
3580  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(info)
3581  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(debug)
3582  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(warn)
3583  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(error)
3584  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(fatal)
3585  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(trace)
3586 # undef LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES
3587 #endif // ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3588  private:
3589  std::string m_id;
3590  base::TypedConfigurations* m_typedConfigurations;
3591  base::type::stringstream_t m_stream;
3592  std::string m_parentApplicationName;
3593  bool m_isConfigured;
3594  Configurations m_configurations;
3595  std::map<Level, unsigned int> m_unflushedCount;
3596  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* m_logStreamsReference;
3597  LogBuilderPtr m_logBuilder;

3599  friend class el::LogMessage;
3600  friend class el::Loggers;
3601  friend class el::Helpers;
3602  friend class el::base::RegisteredLoggers;
3603  friend class el::base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
3604  friend class el::base::MessageBuilder;
3605  friend class el::base::Writer;
3606  friend class el::base::PErrorWriter;
3607  friend class el::base::Storage;
3608  friend class el::base::PerformanceTracker;
3609  friend class el::base::LogDispatcher;
3610 
3611  Logger(void);
3612 
3613 #if ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3614  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3615  void log_(Level, int, const char*, const T&, const Args&...);
3616 
3617  template <typename T>
3618  inline void log_(Level, int, const T&);
3619 
3620  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3621  void log(Level, const char*, const T&, const Args&...);
3622 
3623  template <typename T>
3624  inline void log(Level, const T&);
3625 #endif // ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3626 
3627  void initUnflushedCount(void) {
3628  m_unflushedCount.clear();
3629  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
3630  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
3631  m_unflushedCount.insert(std::make_pair(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), 0));
3632  return false;
3633  });
3634  }
3635 
3636  inline base::type::stringstream_t& stream(void) {
3637  return m_stream;
3638  }
3639 
3640  void resolveLoggerFormatSpec(void) const {
3641  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
3642  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
3643  base::LogFormat* logFormat =
3644  const_cast<base::LogFormat*>(&m_typedConfigurations->logFormat(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex)));
3645  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logFormat->m_format, base::consts::kLoggerIdFormatSpecifier, m_id);
3646  return false;
3647  });
3648  }
3649  };
3650  namespace base {
3652  class RegisteredLoggers : public base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string> {
3653  public:
3654  explicit RegisteredLoggers(const LogBuilderPtr& defaultLogBuilder) :
3655  m_defaultLogBuilder(defaultLogBuilder) {
3656  m_defaultConfigurations.setToDefault();
3657  }
3658 
3659  virtual ~RegisteredLoggers(void) {
3660  unsafeFlushAll();
3661  }
3662 
3663  inline void setDefaultConfigurations(const Configurations& configurations) {
3664  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3665  m_defaultConfigurations.setFromBase(const_cast<Configurations*>(&configurations));
3666  }
3667 
3668  inline Configurations* defaultConfigurations(void) {
3669  return &m_defaultConfigurations;
3670  }
3671 
3672  Logger* get(const std::string& id, bool forceCreation = true) {
3673  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3674  Logger* logger_ = base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string>::get(id);
3675  if (logger_ == nullptr && forceCreation) {
3676  bool validId = Logger::isValidId(id);
3677  if (!validId) {
3678  ELPP_ASSERT(validId, "Invalid logger ID [" << id << "]. Not registering this logger.");
3679  return nullptr;
3680  }
3681  logger_ = new Logger(id, m_defaultConfigurations, &m_logStreamsReference);
3682  logger_->m_logBuilder = m_defaultLogBuilder;
3683  registerNew(id, logger_);
3684  }
3685  return logger_;
3686  }
3687 
3688  bool remove(const std::string& id) {
3689  if (id == "default") {
3690  return false;
3691  }
3692  Logger* logger = base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string>::get(id);
3693  if (logger != nullptr) {
3694  unregister(logger);
3695  }
3696  return true;
3697  }
3698 
3699  inline bool has(const std::string& id) {
3700  return get(id, false) != nullptr;
3701  }
3702 
3703  inline void unregister(Logger*& logger) {
3704  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3705  base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string>::unregister(logger->id());
3706  }
3707 
3708  inline base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference(void) {
3709  return &m_logStreamsReference;
3710  }
3711 
3712  inline void flushAll(void) {
3713  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3714  unsafeFlushAll();
3715  }
3716 
3717  private:
3718  LogBuilderPtr m_defaultLogBuilder;
3719  Configurations m_defaultConfigurations;
3720  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap m_logStreamsReference;
3721  friend class el::base::Storage;
3722 
3723  inline void unsafeFlushAll(void) {
3724  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Flushing all log files");
3725  for (base::LogStreamsReferenceMap::iterator it = m_logStreamsReference.begin();
3726  it != m_logStreamsReference.end(); ++it) {
3727  if (it->second.get() == nullptr) continue;
3728  it->second->flush();
3729  }
3730  }
3731  };
3733  class VRegistry : base::NoCopy, public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3734  public:
3735  explicit VRegistry(base::type::VerboseLevel level, base::type::EnumType* pFlags) : m_level(level), m_pFlags(pFlags) {
3736  }
3737 
3739  inline void setLevel(base::type::VerboseLevel level) {
3740  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3741  if (level < 0)
3742  m_level = 0;
3743  else if (level > 9)
3744  m_level = base::consts::kMaxVerboseLevel;
3745  else
3746  m_level = level;
3747  }
3748 
3749  inline base::type::VerboseLevel level(void) const {
3750  return m_level;
3751  }
3752 
3753  inline void clearModules(void) {
3754  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3755  m_modules.clear();
3756  }
3757 
3758  void setModules(const char* modules) {
3759  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3760  auto addSuffix = [](std::stringstream& ss, const char* sfx, const char* prev) {
3761  if (prev != nullptr && base::utils::Str::endsWith(ss.str(), std::string(prev))) {
3762  std::string chr(ss.str().substr(0, ss.str().size() - strlen(prev)));
3763  ss.str(std::string(""));
3764  ss << chr;
3765  }
3766  if (base::utils::Str::endsWith(ss.str(), std::string(sfx))) {
3767  std::string chr(ss.str().substr(0, ss.str().size() - strlen(sfx)));
3768  ss.str(std::string(""));
3769  ss << chr;
3770  }
3771  ss << sfx;
3772  };
3773  auto insert = [&](std::stringstream& ss, base::type::VerboseLevel level) {
3774  if (!base::utils::hasFlag(LoggingFlag::DisableVModulesExtensions, *m_pFlags)) {
3775  addSuffix(ss, ".h", nullptr);
3776  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3777  addSuffix(ss, ".c", ".h");
3778  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3779  addSuffix(ss, ".cpp", ".c");
3780  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3781  addSuffix(ss, ".cc", ".cpp");
3782  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3783  addSuffix(ss, ".cxx", ".cc");
3784  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3785  addSuffix(ss, ".-inl.h", ".cxx");
3786  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3787  addSuffix(ss, ".hxx", ".-inl.h");
3788  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3789  addSuffix(ss, ".hpp", ".hxx");
3790  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3791  addSuffix(ss, ".hh", ".hpp");
3792  }
3793  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3794  };
3795  bool isMod = true;
3796  bool isLevel = false;
3797  std::stringstream ss;
3798  int level = -1;
3799  for (; *modules; ++modules) {
3800  switch (*modules) {
3801  case '=':
3802  isLevel = true;
3803  isMod = false;
3804  break;
3805  case ',':
3806  isLevel = false;
3807  isMod = true;
3808  if (!ss.str().empty() && level != -1) {
3809  insert(ss, level);
3810  ss.str(std::string(""));
3811  level = -1;
3812  }
3813  break;
3814  default:
3815  if (isMod) {
3816  ss << *modules;
3817  } else if (isLevel) {
3818  if (isdigit(*modules)) {
3819  level = static_cast<base::type::VerboseLevel>(*modules) - 48;
3820  }
3821  }
3822  break;
3823  }
3824  }
3825  if (!ss.str().empty() && level != -1) {
3826  insert(ss, level);
3827  }
3828  }
3829 
3830  bool allowed(base::type::VerboseLevel vlevel, const char* file) {
3831  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3832  if (m_modules.empty() || file == nullptr) {
3833  return vlevel <= m_level;
3834  } else {
3835  std::map<std::string, base::type::VerboseLevel>::iterator it = m_modules.begin();
3836  for (; it != m_modules.end(); ++it) {
3837  if (base::utils::Str::wildCardMatch(file, it->first.c_str())) {
3838  return vlevel <= it->second;
3839  }
3840  }
3841  if (base::utils::hasFlag(LoggingFlag::AllowVerboseIfModuleNotSpecified, *m_pFlags)) {
3842  return true;
3843  }
3844  return false;
3845  }
3846  }
3847 
3848  inline const std::map<std::string, base::type::VerboseLevel>& modules(void) const {
3849  return m_modules;
3850  }
3851 
3852  void setFromArgs(const base::utils::CommandLineArgs* commandLineArgs) {
3853  if (commandLineArgs->hasParam("-v") || commandLineArgs->hasParam("--verbose") ||
3854  commandLineArgs->hasParam("-V") || commandLineArgs->hasParam("--VERBOSE")) {
3855  setLevel(base::consts::kMaxVerboseLevel);
3856  } else if (commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("--v")) {
3857  setLevel(atoi(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("--v")));
3858  } else if (commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("--V")) {
3859  setLevel(atoi(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("--V")));
3860  } else if ((commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("-vmodule")) && vModulesEnabled()) {
3861  setModules(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("-vmodule"));
3862  } else if (commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("-VMODULE") && vModulesEnabled()) {
3863  setModules(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("-VMODULE"));
3864  }
3865  }
3866 
3868  inline bool vModulesEnabled(void) {
3869  return !base::utils::hasFlag(LoggingFlag::DisableVModules, *m_pFlags);
3870  }
3871 
3872  private:
3873  base::type::VerboseLevel m_level;
3874  base::type::EnumType* m_pFlags;
3875  std::map<std::string, base::type::VerboseLevel> m_modules;
3876  };
3877  } // namespace base
3878  class LogMessage {
3879  public:
3880  LogMessage(Level level, const std::string& file, unsigned long int line, const std::string& func,
3881  base::type::VerboseLevel verboseLevel, Logger* logger) :
3882  m_level(level), m_file(file), m_line(line), m_func(func),
3883  m_verboseLevel(verboseLevel), m_logger(logger), m_message(logger->stream().str()) {
3884  }
3885  inline Level level(void) const { return m_level; }
3886  inline const std::string& file(void) const { return m_file; }
3887  inline unsigned long int line(void) const { return m_line; } // NOLINT
3888  inline const std::string& func(void) const { return m_func; }
3889  inline base::type::VerboseLevel verboseLevel(void) const { return m_verboseLevel; }
3890  inline Logger* logger(void) const { return m_logger; }
3891  inline const base::type::string_t& message(void) const { return m_message; }
3892  private:
3893  Level m_level;
3894  std::string m_file;
3895  unsigned long int m_line;
3896  std::string m_func;
3897  base::type::VerboseLevel m_verboseLevel;
3898  Logger* m_logger;
3899  base::type::string_t m_message;
3900  };
3901  namespace base {
3902 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3903  class AsyncLogItem {
3904  public:
3905  explicit AsyncLogItem(const LogMessage& logMessage, const LogDispatchData& data, const base::type::string_t& logLine)
3906  : m_logMessage(logMessage), m_dispatchData(data), m_logLine(logLine) {}
3907  virtual ~AsyncLogItem() {}
3908  inline LogMessage* logMessage(void) { return &m_logMessage; }
3909  inline LogDispatchData* data(void) { return &m_dispatchData; }
3910  inline base::type::string_t logLine(void) { return m_logLine; }
3911  private:
3912  LogMessage m_logMessage;
3913  LogDispatchData m_dispatchData;
3914  base::type::string_t m_logLine;
3915  };
3916  class AsyncLogQueue : public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3917  public:
3918  virtual ~AsyncLogQueue() {
3919  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(6, "~AsyncLogQueue");
3920  }
3921 
3922  inline AsyncLogItem next(void) {
3923  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3924  AsyncLogItem result = m_queue.front();
3925  m_queue.pop();
3926  return result;
3927  }
3928 
3929  inline void push(const AsyncLogItem& item) {
3930  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3931  m_queue.push(item);
3932  }
3933  inline void pop(void) {
3934  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3935  m_queue.pop();
3936  }
3937  inline AsyncLogItem front(void) {
3938  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3939  return m_queue.front();
3940  }
3941  inline bool empty(void) {
3942  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3943  return m_queue.empty();
3944  }
3945  private:
3946  std::queue<AsyncLogItem> m_queue;
3947  };
3948  class IWorker {
3949  public:
3950  virtual ~IWorker() {}
3951  virtual void start() = 0;
3952  };
3953 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3954  class Storage : base::NoCopy, public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3956  public:
3957 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3958  Storage(const LogBuilderPtr& defaultLogBuilder, base::IWorker* asyncDispatchWorker) :
3959 #else
3960  explicit Storage(const LogBuilderPtr& defaultLogBuilder) :
3961 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3962  m_registeredHitCounters(new base::RegisteredHitCounters()),
3963  m_registeredLoggers(new base::RegisteredLoggers(defaultLogBuilder)),
3964  m_flags(0x0),
3965  m_vRegistry(new base::VRegistry(0, &m_flags)),
3966 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3967  m_asyncLogQueue(new base::AsyncLogQueue()),
3968  m_asyncDispatchWorker(asyncDispatchWorker),
3969 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3970  m_preRollOutCallback(base::defaultPreRollOutCallback) {
3971  // Register default logger
3972  m_registeredLoggers->get(std::string(base::consts::kDefaultLoggerId));
3973  // Register performance logger and reconfigure format
3974  Logger* performanceLogger = m_registeredLoggers->get(std::string(base::consts::kPerformanceLoggerId));
3975  performanceLogger->configurations()->setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level %msg"));
3976  performanceLogger->reconfigure();
3977 #if defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
3978  // Register syslog logger and reconfigure format
3979  Logger* sysLogLogger = m_registeredLoggers->get(std::string(base::consts::kSysLogLoggerId));
3980  sysLogLogger->configurations()->setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%level: %msg"));
3981  sysLogLogger->reconfigure();
3982 #endif // defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
3983  addFlag(LoggingFlag::AllowVerboseIfModuleNotSpecified);
3984 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3985  installLogDispatchCallback<base::AsyncLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("AsyncLogDispatchCallback"));
3986 #else
3987  installLogDispatchCallback<base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("DefaultLogDispatchCallback"));
3988 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3989  installPerformanceTrackingCallback<base::DefaultPerformanceTrackingCallback>(std::string("DefaultPerformanceTrackingCallback"));
3990  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Easylogging++ has been initialized");
3991 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3992  m_asyncDispatchWorker->start();
3993 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3994  }
3995 
3996  virtual ~Storage(void) {
3997  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(4, "Destroying storage");
3998 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3999  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Replacing log dispatch callback to synchronous");
4000  uninstallLogDispatchCallback<base::AsyncLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("AsyncLogDispatchCallback"));
4001  installLogDispatchCallback<base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("DefaultLogDispatchCallback"));
4002  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying asyncDispatchWorker");
4003  base::utils::safeDelete(m_asyncDispatchWorker);
4004  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying asyncLogQueue");
4005  base::utils::safeDelete(m_asyncLogQueue);
4006 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4007  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying registeredHitCounters");
4008  base::utils::safeDelete(m_registeredHitCounters);
4009  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying registeredLoggers");
4010  base::utils::safeDelete(m_registeredLoggers);
4011  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying vRegistry");
4012  base::utils::safeDelete(m_vRegistry);
4013  }
4014 
4015  inline bool validateEveryNCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t occasion) {
4016  return hitCounters()->validateEveryN(filename, lineNumber, occasion);
4017  }
4018 
4019  inline bool validateAfterNCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) { // NOLINT
4020  return hitCounters()->validateAfterN(filename, lineNumber, n);
4021  }
4022 
4023  inline bool validateNTimesCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) { // NOLINT
4024  return hitCounters()->validateNTimes(filename, lineNumber, n);
4025  }

4046  return &m_commandLineArgs;
4047  }

4050  base::utils::addFlag(flag, &m_flags);
4051  }
4052

4054  base::utils::removeFlag(flag, &m_flags);
4055  }

4058  return base::utils::hasFlag(flag, m_flags);
4059  }

4062  return m_flags;
4063  }

4066  m_flags = flags;
4067  }

4069  inline void setPreRollOutCallback(const PreRollOutCallback& callback) {
4070  m_preRollOutCallback = callback;
4071  }
4072 
4073  inline void unsetPreRollOutCallback(void) {
4074  m_preRollOutCallback = base::defaultPreRollOutCallback;
4075  }

4077  inline PreRollOutCallback& preRollOutCallback(void) {
4078  return m_preRollOutCallback;
4079  }
4080 
4081  inline bool hasCustomFormatSpecifier(const char* formatSpecifier) {
4082  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
4083  return std::find(m_customFormatSpecifiers.begin(), m_customFormatSpecifiers.end(),
4084  formatSpecifier) != m_customFormatSpecifiers.end();
4085  }
4086 
4087  inline void installCustomFormatSpecifier(const CustomFormatSpecifier& customFormatSpecifier) {
4088  if (hasCustomFormatSpecifier(customFormatSpecifier.formatSpecifier())) {
4089  return;
4090  }
4091  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
4092  m_customFormatSpecifiers.push_back(customFormatSpecifier);
4093  }
4094 
4095  inline bool uninstallCustomFormatSpecifier(const char* formatSpecifier) {
4096  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
4097  std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier>::iterator it = std::find(m_customFormatSpecifiers.begin(),
4098  m_customFormatSpecifiers.end(), formatSpecifier);
4099  if (it != m_customFormatSpecifiers.end() && strcmp(formatSpecifier, it->formatSpecifier()) == 0) {
4100  m_customFormatSpecifiers.erase(it);
4101  return true;
4102  }
4103  return false;
4104  }
4105 
4106  const std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier>* customFormatSpecifiers(void) const {
4107  return &m_customFormatSpecifiers;
4108  }
4109 
4110  inline void setLoggingLevel(Level level) {
4111  m_loggingLevel = level;
4112  }
4113 
4114  template <typename T>
4115  inline bool installLogDispatchCallback(const std::string& id) {
4116  return installCallback<T, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>(id, &m_logDispatchCallbacks);
4117  }
4118 
4119  template <typename T>
4120  inline void uninstallLogDispatchCallback(const std::string& id) {
4121  uninstallCallback<T, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>(id, &m_logDispatchCallbacks);
4122  }
4123  template <typename T>
4124  inline T* logDispatchCallback(const std::string& id) {
4125  return callback<T, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>(id, &m_logDispatchCallbacks);
4126  }
4127 
4128  template <typename T>
4129  inline bool installPerformanceTrackingCallback(const std::string& id) {
4130  return installCallback<T, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr>(id, &m_performanceTrackingCallbacks);
4131  }
4132 
4133  template <typename T>
4134  inline void uninstallPerformanceTrackingCallback(const std::string& id) {
4135  uninstallCallback<T, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr>(id, &m_performanceTrackingCallbacks);
4136  }
4137 
4138  template <typename T>
4139  inline T* performanceTrackingCallback(const std::string& id) {
4140  return callback<T, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr>(id, &m_performanceTrackingCallbacks);
4141  }
4142  private:
4143  base::RegisteredHitCounters* m_registeredHitCounters;
4144  base::RegisteredLoggers* m_registeredLoggers;
4145  base::type::EnumType m_flags;
4146  base::VRegistry* m_vRegistry;
4147 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4148  base::AsyncLogQueue* m_asyncLogQueue;
4149  base::IWorker* m_asyncDispatchWorker;
4150 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4151  base::utils::CommandLineArgs m_commandLineArgs;
4152  PreRollOutCallback m_preRollOutCallback;
4153  std::map<std::string, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr> m_logDispatchCallbacks;
4154  std::map<std::string, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr> m_performanceTrackingCallbacks;
4155  std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier> m_customFormatSpecifiers;
4156  Level m_loggingLevel;
4157 
4158  friend class el::Helpers;
4159  friend class el::base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
4160  friend class el::LogBuilder;
4161  friend class el::base::MessageBuilder;
4162  friend class el::base::Writer;
4163  friend class el::base::PerformanceTracker;
4164  friend class el::base::LogDispatcher;
4165 
4166  void setApplicationArguments(int argc, char** argv) {
4167  m_commandLineArgs.setArgs(argc, argv);
4168  m_vRegistry->setFromArgs(commandLineArgs());
4169  // default log file
4170 #if !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_LOG_FILE_FROM_ARG)
4171  if (m_commandLineArgs.hasParamWithValue(base::consts::kDefaultLogFileParam)) {
4172  Configurations c;
4173  c.setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Filename, std::string(m_commandLineArgs.getParamValue(base::consts::kDefaultLogFileParam)));
4174  registeredLoggers()->setDefaultConfigurations(c);
4175  for (base::RegisteredLoggers::iterator it = registeredLoggers()->begin();
4176  it != registeredLoggers()->end(); ++it) {
4177  it->second->configure(c);
4178  }
4179  }
4180 #endif // !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_LOG_FILE_FROM_ARG)
4181 #if defined(ELPP_LOGGING_FLAGS_FROM_ARG)
4182  if (m_commandLineArgs.hasParamWithValue(base::consts::kLoggingFlagsParam)) {
4183  m_flags = atoi(m_commandLineArgs.getParamValue(base::consts::kLoggingFlagsParam));
4184  }
4185 #endif // defined(ELPP_LOGGING_FLAGS_FROM_ARG)
4186  }
4187 
4188  inline void setApplicationArguments(int argc, const char** argv) {
4189  setApplicationArguments(argc, const_cast<char**>(argv));
4190  }
4191 
4192  template <typename T, typename TPtr>
4193  inline bool installCallback(const std::string& id, std::map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
4194  if (mapT->find(id) == mapT->end()) {
4195  mapT->insert(std::make_pair(id, TPtr(new T())));
4196  return true;
4197  }
4198  return false;
4199  }
4200 
4201  template <typename T, typename TPtr>
4202  inline void uninstallCallback(const std::string& id, std::map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
4203  if (mapT->find(id) != mapT->end()) {
4204  mapT->erase(id);
4205  }
4206  }
4207 
4208  template <typename T, typename TPtr>
4209  inline T* callback(const std::string& id, std::map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
4210  typename std::map<std::string, TPtr>::iterator iter = mapT->find(id);
4211  if (iter != mapT->end()) {
4212  return static_cast<T*>(iter->second.get());
4213  }
4214  return nullptr;
4215  }
4216  };
4217  extern ELPP_EXPORT base::type::StoragePointer elStorage;
4218 #define ELPP el::base::elStorage
4219  class DefaultLogDispatchCallback : public LogDispatchCallback {
4220  protected:
4221  void handle(const LogDispatchData* data) {
4222  m_data = data;
4223  dispatch(m_data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->build(m_data->logMessage(),
4224  m_data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog));
4225  }
4226  private:
4227  const LogDispatchData* m_data;
4228  void dispatch(base::type::string_t&& logLine) {
4229  if (m_data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog) {
4230  if (m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->toFile(m_data->logMessage()->level())) {
4231  base::type::fstream_t* fs = m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->fileStream(m_data->logMessage()->level());
4232  if (fs != nullptr) {
4233  fs->write(logLine.c_str(), logLine.size());
4234  if (fs->fail()) {
4235  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to write log to file ["
4236  << m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->filename(m_data->logMessage()->level()) << "].\n"
4237  << "Few possible reasons (could be something else):\n" << " * Permission denied\n"
4238  << " * Disk full\n" << " * Disk is not writable", true);
4239  } else {
4240  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ImmediateFlush) || (m_data->logMessage()->logger()->isFlushNeeded(m_data->logMessage()->level()))) {
4241  m_data->logMessage()->logger()->flush(m_data->logMessage()->level(), fs);
4242  }
4243  }
4244  } else {
4245  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Log file for [" << LevelHelper::convertToString(m_data->logMessage()->level()) << "] "
4246  << "has not been configured but [TO_FILE] is configured to TRUE. [Logger ID: "
4247  << m_data->logMessage()->logger()->id() << "]", false);
4248  }
4249  }
4250  if (m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->toStandardOutput(m_data->logMessage()->level())) {
4251  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ColoredTerminalOutput))
4252  m_data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->convertToColoredOutput(&logLine, m_data->logMessage()->level());
4253  ELPP_COUT << ELPP_COUT_LINE(logLine);
4254  }
4255  }
4256 #if defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4257  else if (m_data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::SysLog) {
4258  // Determine syslog priority
4259  int sysLogPriority = 0;
4260  if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Fatal)
4261  sysLogPriority = LOG_EMERG;
4262  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Error)
4263  sysLogPriority = LOG_ERR;
4264  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Warning)
4265  sysLogPriority = LOG_WARNING;
4266  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Info)
4267  sysLogPriority = LOG_INFO;
4268  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Debug)
4269  sysLogPriority = LOG_DEBUG;
4270  else
4271  sysLogPriority = LOG_NOTICE;
4272 # if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
4273  char* line = base::utils::Str::wcharPtrToCharPtr(logLine.c_str());
4274  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", line);
4275  free(line);
4276 # else
4277  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", logLine.c_str());
4278 # endif
4279  }
4280 #endif // defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4281  }
4282  };
4283 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4284  class AsyncLogDispatchCallback : public LogDispatchCallback {
4285  protected:
4286  void handle(const LogDispatchData* data) {
4287  base::type::string_t logLine = data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->build(data->logMessage(), data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog);
4288  if (data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog && data->logMessage()->logger()->typedConfigurations()->toStandardOutput(data->logMessage()->level())) {
4289  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ColoredTerminalOutput))
4290  data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->convertToColoredOutput(&logLine, data->logMessage()->level());
4291  ELPP_COUT << ELPP_COUT_LINE(logLine);
4292  }
4293  // Save resources and only queue if we want to write to file otherwise just ignore handler
4294  if (data->logMessage()->logger()->typedConfigurations()->toFile(data->logMessage()->level())) {
4295  ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->push(AsyncLogItem(*(data->logMessage()), *data, logLine));
4296  }
4297  }
4298  };
4299  class AsyncDispatchWorker : public base::IWorker, public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
4300  public:
4301  AsyncDispatchWorker() {
4302  setContinueRunning(false);
4303  }
4304 
4305  virtual ~AsyncDispatchWorker() {
4306  setContinueRunning(false);
4307  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(6, "Stopping dispatch worker - Cleaning log queue");
4308  clean();
4309  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(6, "Log queue cleaned");
4310  }
4311 
4312  inline bool clean(void) {
4313  std::mutex m;
4314  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lk(m);
4315  cv.wait(lk, []{ return !ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->empty(); });
4316  emptyQueue();
4317  lk.unlock();
4318  cv.notify_one();
4319  return ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->empty();
4320  }
4321 
4322  inline void emptyQueue(void) {
4323  while (!ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->empty()) {
4324  AsyncLogItem data = ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->next();
4325  handle(&data);
4326  base::threading::msleep(100);
4327  }
4328  }
4329 
4330  virtual inline void start(void) {
4331  base::threading::msleep(5000); // 5s (why?)
4332  setContinueRunning(true);
4333  std::thread t1(&AsyncDispatchWorker::run, this);
4334  t1.join();
4335  }
4336 
4337  void handle(AsyncLogItem* logItem) {
4338  LogDispatchData* data = logItem->data();
4339  LogMessage* logMessage = logItem->logMessage();
4340  Logger* logger = logMessage->logger();
4341  base::TypedConfigurations* conf = logger->typedConfigurations();
4342  base::type::string_t logLine = logItem->logLine();
4343  if (data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog) {
4344  if (conf->toFile(logMessage->level())) {
4345  base::type::fstream_t* fs = conf->fileStream(logMessage->level());
4346  if (fs != nullptr) {
4347  fs->write(logLine.c_str(), logLine.size());
4348  if (fs->fail()) {
4349  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to write log to file ["
4350  << conf->filename(logMessage->level()) << "].\n"
4351  << "Few possible reasons (could be something else):\n" << " * Permission denied\n"
4352  << " * Disk full\n" << " * Disk is not writable", true);
4353  } else {
4354  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ImmediateFlush) || (logger->isFlushNeeded(logMessage->level()))) {
4355  logger->flush(logMessage->level(), fs);
4356  }
4357  }
4358  } else {
4359  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Log file for [" << LevelHelper::convertToString(logMessage->level()) << "] "
4360  << "has not been configured but [TO_FILE] is configured to TRUE. [Logger ID: " << logger->id() << "]", false);
4361  }
4362  }
4363  }
4364 # if defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4365  else if (data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::SysLog) {
4366  // Determine syslog priority
4367  int sysLogPriority = 0;
4368  if (logMessage->level() == Level::Fatal)
4369  sysLogPriority = LOG_EMERG;
4370  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Error)
4371  sysLogPriority = LOG_ERR;
4372  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Warning)
4373  sysLogPriority = LOG_WARNING;
4374  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Info)
4375  sysLogPriority = LOG_INFO;
4376  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Debug)
4377  sysLogPriority = LOG_DEBUG;
4378  else
4379  sysLogPriority = LOG_NOTICE;
4380 # if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
4381  char* line = base::utils::Str::wcharPtrToCharPtr(logLine.c_str());
4382  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", line);
4383  free(line);
4384 # else
4385  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", logLine.c_str());
4386 # endif
4387  }
4388 # endif // defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4389  }
4390 
4391  void run(void) {
4392  while (continueRunning()) {
4393  emptyQueue();
4394  base::threading::msleep(10); // 10ms
4395  }
4396  }
4397 
4398  void setContinueRunning(bool value) {
4399  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(m_continueRunningMutex);
4400  m_continueRunning = value;
4401  }
4402 
4403  bool continueRunning(void) const {
4404  return m_continueRunning;
4405  }
4406  private:
4407  std::condition_variable cv;
4408  bool m_continueRunning;
4409  base::threading::Mutex m_continueRunningMutex;
4410  };
4411 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4412  } // namespace base
4413  namespace base {
4414  class DefaultLogBuilder : public LogBuilder {
4415  public:
4416  base::type::string_t build(const LogMessage* logMessage, bool appendNewLine) const {
4417  base::TypedConfigurations* tc = logMessage->logger()->typedConfigurations();
4418  const base::LogFormat* logFormat = &tc->logFormat(logMessage->level());
4419  base::type::string_t logLine = logFormat->format();
4420  char buff[base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength + base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength] = "";
4421  const char* bufLim = buff + sizeof(buff);
4422  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::AppName)) {
4423  // App name
4424  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kAppNameFormatSpecifier,
4425  logMessage->logger()->parentApplicationName());
4426  }
4427  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::ThreadId)) {
4428  // Thread ID
4429  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kThreadIdFormatSpecifier,
4430  base::threading::getCurrentThreadId());
4431  }
4432  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::DateTime)) {
4433  // DateTime
4434  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kDateTimeFormatSpecifier,
4435  base::utils::DateTime::getDateTime(logFormat->dateTimeFormat().c_str(),
4436  &tc->millisecondsWidth(logMessage->level())));
4437  }
4438  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::Function)) {
4439  // Function
4440  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogFunctionFormatSpecifier, logMessage->func());
4441  }
4442  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::File)) {
4443  // File
4444  base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength);
4445  base::utils::File::buildStrippedFilename(logMessage->file().c_str(), buff);
4446  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogFileFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4447  }
4448  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::FileBase)) {
4449  // FileBase
4450  base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength);
4451  base::utils::File::buildBaseFilename(logMessage->file(), buff);
4452  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogFileBaseFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4453  }
4454  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::Line)) {
4455  // Line
4456  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength);
4457  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(logMessage->line(), base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength, buf, bufLim, false);
4458  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogLineFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4459  }
4460  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::Location)) {
4461  // Location
4462  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength + base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength);
4463  base::utils::File::buildStrippedFilename(logMessage->file().c_str(), buff);
4464  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(buff, buf, bufLim);
4465  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(":", buf, bufLim);
4466  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(logMessage->line(), base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength, buf, bufLim, false);
4467  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogLocationFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4468  }
4469  if (logMessage->level() == Level::Verbose && logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::VerboseLevel)) {
4470  // Verbose level
4471  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, 1);
4472  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(logMessage->verboseLevel(), 1, buf, bufLim, false);
4473  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kVerboseLevelFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4474  }
4475  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::LogMessage)) {
4476  // Log message
4477  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kMessageFormatSpecifier, logMessage->message());
4478  }
4479 #if !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_CUSTOM_FORMAT_SPECIFIERS)
4480  for (std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier>::const_iterator it = ELPP->customFormatSpecifiers()->begin();
4481  it != ELPP->customFormatSpecifiers()->end(); ++it) {
4482  std::string fs(it->formatSpecifier());
4483  base::type::string_t wcsFormatSpecifier(fs.begin(), fs.end());
4484  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, wcsFormatSpecifier, std::string(it->resolver()()));
4485  }
4486 #endif // !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_CUSTOM_FORMAT_SPECIFIERS)
4487  if (appendNewLine) logLine += ELPP_LITERAL("\n");
4488  return logLine;
4489  }
4490  };
4492  class LogDispatcher : base::NoCopy {
4493  public:
4494  LogDispatcher(bool proceed, LogMessage&& logMessage, base::DispatchAction dispatchAction) :
4495  m_proceed(proceed),
4496  m_logMessage(std::move(logMessage)),
4497  m_dispatchAction(std::move(dispatchAction)) {
4498  }
4499 
4500  void dispatch(void) {
4501  if (m_proceed && m_dispatchAction == base::DispatchAction::None) {
4502  m_proceed = false;
4503  }
4504  if (!m_proceed) {
4505  return;
4506  }
4507  // We minimize the time of ELPP's lock - this lock is released after log is written
4508  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(ELPP->lock());
4509  base::TypedConfigurations* tc = m_logMessage.logger()->m_typedConfigurations;
4510  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::StrictLogFileSizeCheck)) {
4511  tc->validateFileRolling(m_logMessage.level(), ELPP->preRollOutCallback());
4512  }
4513  LogDispatchCallback* callback = nullptr;
4514  LogDispatchData data;
4515  for (const std::pair<std::string, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>& h
4516  : ELPP->m_logDispatchCallbacks) {
4517  callback = h.second.get();
4518  if (callback != nullptr && callback->enabled()) {
4519  data.setLogMessage(&m_logMessage);
4520  data.setDispatchAction(m_dispatchAction);
4521  callback->acquireLock();
4522  callback->handle(&data);
4523  callback->releaseLock();
4524  }
4525  }
4526  }
4527 
4528  private:
4529  bool m_proceed;
4530  LogMessage m_logMessage;
4531  base::DispatchAction m_dispatchAction;
4532  };
4533 #if defined(ELPP_STL_LOGGING)
4534  namespace workarounds {
4542  template <typename T, typename Container>
4543  class IterableContainer {
4544  public:
4545  typedef typename Container::iterator iterator;
4546  typedef typename Container::const_iterator const_iterator;
4547  IterableContainer(void) {}
4548  virtual ~IterableContainer(void) {}
4549  iterator begin(void) { return getContainer().begin(); }
4550  iterator end(void) { return getContainer().end(); }
4551  private:
4552  virtual Container& getContainer(void) = 0;
4553  };
4555  template<typename T, typename Container = std::vector<T>, typename Comparator = std::less<typename Container::value_type>>
4556  class IterablePriorityQueue : public IterableContainer<T, Container>, public std::priority_queue<T, Container, Comparator> {
4557  public:
4558  IterablePriorityQueue(std::priority_queue<T, Container, Comparator> queue_) {
4559  std::size_t count_ = 0;
